headline: Data Analyst at TBWA\The Disruption Company | Singapore Management University | Digital Marketing | Strategy | Analytics
about:
I am currently at TBWA,Singapore helping advertisers understand the 'right' way to measure digital advertising, and demonstrating how effective their social strategy executions on the platform were in impacting business metrics; I have more than 3 years of experience in digital marketing and analytics working with Fortune 500 companies across various domains such as financial services, retail & consumer goods and aviation



Holds an Master's degree from Singapore Management University (SMU), Singapore and a bachelor's of engineering in Computer Science engineering.



Areas of experience: Customer Insights, Digital Marketing, Financial services, Retail & Consumer Goods, Customer Strategy, Marketing Analytics, Fintech



Feel free to email me at nikita.gupta16@gmail.com.

headline: Senior Data Analyst at Shopee
about:
Timothy has a huge passion for data analytics. He seeks to acquire the technical knowledge to conduct end-to-end data analysis, from data processing to Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) and finally to applying Machine Learning algorithms (if need be). He aspires to use data to drive business decisions.



Skills: Python, Pyspark, Hive, Hadoop, Airflow
experiences:
[{'title': 'Senior Data Analyst', 'company': 'Shopee', 'duation_date': 'Jan 2018 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 yr 9 mos', 'description': 'Shopee is one of the top e-commerce company in Southeast Asia and Taiwan. As a data analyst, my main responsibility is to familiarise myself with the data sitting in the data warehouse and thereafter extract, load and transform them into readable data for the business team to use. My day-to-day work requires me to use Big Data technologies such as Hive, Hadoop, Pyspark and Airflow. Below are my responsibilities:

- Building and maintaining ETL pipelines to ingest data from the data warehouse to data marts where business users can easily extract data from
- Designing and automating reports using Python and Airflow
- Conducting deep dive analysis for ad-hoc requests
- Creating dashboards using Lumos

headline: Senior Data Analyst at Grab
about:
• SAS BIA Program is part of IDA’s Company-Led Training (CLT) initiative to recruit and train fresh professionals in Business Intelligence and Analytics.

• Underwent a 3 months training at SAS, inclusive of hands-on, theory and SAS certification.

• Took and successfully passed the SAS Enterprise-Miner Certification.

• Scraped the major Singapore tourist attraction reviews from Trip Advisor and performed Text Mining on them using SAS Enterprise-Miner.

• Used Python’s NLTK package to perform natural language processing on the TripAdvisor data at ST Electronics.

• Created a basic user interface using Python’s Flask web framework to allow a simple queries to be performed on the TripAdvisor data, which was stored in a SQLite database.

• Processed and visualised several types of IoT censor data that were deployed at the Jurong Lake District to identify erroneous censors that were to be fixed by the technical teams.



SAS software exposure: SAS 9.3, SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner, JMP Pro, SAS Visual Analysis, SAS Business Intelligence, Information Delivery Portal, Web Report Studio, BI Dashboard

headline: Senior Data Analyst at TÜV SÜD
about:
• Develop machine learning models to forecast the demand of inventory items and to optimize them accordingly to reduce storage cost and increase profit.

• Develop models using certain econometric attributes to forecast the fluctuating prices of textile commodities to reduce the risk of losses in trade.

•Develop sales forecasting models for various business units, salesman and sales offices on a monthly basis, bimonthly and quarterly basis.

• Optimize and set threshold to the gross profit of each trade to make sure its associated charges is lesser than the gross profit.

• To process and structure the raw marketing data to a database model to generate standard reports, ad hoc reports and alerts to the marketing managers for monitoring and decision making.

• Design live interactive performance dashboard for the different sales team across markets to the respective stakeholders.

• RFM Analysis of the current customers on a regular basis to render quality service to the elite customers and to prevent potential churns.

• Identify the prospective customers of each markets (countries) by customer segmentation and profiling (clustering) by using external data.

• Quarterly and annual presentation of insights discovered from various data to the business stakeholders to facilitate strategy making and business improvement.

headline: Lead Analyst (Healthcare Data Analytics)
about:
I am embarking on a journey in using data to improve our healthcare in Singapore.



I am currently working in the Ministry of Health (Singapore) to support the data analytical work in the ministry. Prior to this adventure, I was a business analyst for 6 years in a local SME.



Also, I have completed a Master of IT in Business (Analytics) from Singapore Management University in Aug 2017 (2 year part-time). I have graduated with a GPA 4.0/4.0 (Dean List) and awarded with IMDA Gold Medal Award 2018.



Now, I am focusing on continuous learning in the areas of data science - especially in these areas of data visualizations, big data management, machine learning, web development, and their applications.



I believe that a person's character, attitude, and skill & knowledge will define the true value of one's worth. Success is not defined by how much one has gained for oneself, but instead; how much one has given back to the community.



"If you want something you've never had, you must be willing to do something you've never done." - Thomas Jefferson



Personal Portfolio:

Github: https://github.com/hanyingong

Tableau : https://public.tableau.com/profile/ong.han.ying#!/

Email: mynameishanying@gmail.com

twitter : https://twitter.com/iamhanying

Medium : https://medium.com/mynameishanying

Website : []



Work Contact:

AIMD's Gov Directory: https://www.gov.sg/sgdi/ministries/moh/departments/moh-hq/departments/pcg/departments/dag/departments/aim

headline: Data Analyst at Land Transport Authority (LTA) Singapore
about:
As an economics graduate, dealing with data is an everyday affair. What is exciting to me is being able to understand data and appreciate the hidden messages behind what they mean to solve the daily problems we encounter.



While capturing these messages accurately is not an easy task, this challenges me to seek knowledge to broaden my domain skills with the ultimate aim of interpreting these messages with clarity and precision.



There is always room for dispute over how the data was interpreted today. The absence of objection towards its current interpretation does not mean it is the best and accurate way to look at it tomorrow.

headline: Market Data Analyst at Bloomberg LP
about:
In 2017, I embarked on a solo road trip in the Scottish Highlands. Everybody thought I was mad; I hadn't driven a car in 10 years and nobody really thought of me as the independent, adventurous type. How could I possibly survive on my own in the unpredictable Scottish weather?



I completed it in the same way I approach everything in life. I am an experience-seeker with a can-do attitude: if something piques my curiosity, no matter how tough, I explore it with full belief that I can succeed. That is how I conquered the hike to the Old Man of Storr in bitter rain and wind, how I took up muay thai and rugby despite not being the most sporty person around and how I taught myself basic coding in Python while managing a busy work schedule.



Now, I embark on a career switch to data analytics with the same attitude. Coming from a completely different background, this step in my career may appear to be a daunting task, not dissimilar to climbing a steep rocky hill in the cold battered by wind and rain. From experience, I know I will pull it off.



In my spare time, I enjoy reading and travelling. I believe that having a growth mindset is key to succeeding anywhere in life.



If you're interested to chat over coffee (or matcha!), please feel free to send a message.

headline: Data Analyst at MSD | R | Oracle PLSQL | Apex | ML | Spotfire
about:
My fascination towards data and leveraging it in order to make informed decisions, coupled with a strong analytical ability led me to pursue a career in the field of Analytics/Data Science.



I am currently working as a Data Analyst at MSD, Singapore after having completing my Masters in Analytics from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore. The course has made me familiar with topics such as Data Mining, Machine Learning, Databases, Operations Research, Financial and Risk Analytics, Web Analytics etc. I am also well versed with tools such as R, Python, Tableau, Weka apart from being proficient in Java and PL/SQL Technologies. I have interned as a Data Analyst at PSA International Pte. Ltd., Singapore.



I was previously working with Accenture as a Software Engineer.



Contact: tr.gautham@gmail.com

headline: Data Analyst at ST Electronics (Info-Software Systems) Pte. Ltd.
about:
• Leveraged Time-Series (ARMA and ARIMA), K-means Clustering, Logistic Regression and Decision Tree algorithms from SPSS Modeler and R to forecast housing prices and classify housing flat types, with best classification models obtaining accuracy of 96%.



• Modeled companies KPI trends using various random walk and exponential smoothing techniques in SAS Enterprise Guide on a recurring basis.



• Set up and configured a fully-distributed Hadoop system on Ubuntu OS virtual machines. Able to proficiently query data from HDFS using hive and transfer data between HDFS and relational databases such as MySql using sqoop.



• Supported the ETL process of a Data Warehouse project through drafting SQL scripts in SQL Developer to extract Application Form data stored in XML format.



• Implemented a Business Intelligence COTS solution in a 3-tier environment, involving in an end-to-end process of setting up the environment in virtual machines, integration of application with Active Directory through LDAPS, designing application user access control matrix according to users requirement, generating reports and dashboards with real-time data, and delivered the application training sessions to end-users all within a duration of 5 months.



• Attended formal trainings on SAP Lumira, Elixir Repertoire and Tableau to explore and visualize data for greater insights.

about: Committed individual with analytical mindset seeking to drive value and sound business decisions through data. A fast learner with good foundation in Python, statistical modelling and machine learning. Always up for meaningful discussions and sharing of ideas.
experiences:
[{'title': 'Data Analyst, Customer Analytics & Decision Sciences', 'company': 'GREAT EASTERN', 'duation_date': 'Sep 2018 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 yr 1 mo', 'description': 'Nil'}, {'title': 'Teaching Assistant', 'company': 'General Assembly', 'duation_date': 'May 2018 – Aug 2018', 'duration_length': '4 mos', 'description': '• Instructional team tutoring a class of 20 on data science concepts via lectures, projects and'}, {'title': 'Data Science Immersive Graduate', 'company': 'General Assembly', 'duation_date': 'Feb 2018 – May 2018', 'duration_length': '4 mos', 'description': '• Completed a 12-week boot camp where I acquired skills in: Python and Descriptive Statistics (Project 1); Exploratory Data Analysis and Visualisation (Project 2: SAT scores); Feature Engineering, Imbalanced Data Handling and Data Modeling (Project 3: Housing Price); Natural Language Processing and Classification (Project 4: Job Postings).

headline: Big Data Consultant and Data Analyst
about:
Planning for Land Transport Network (PLANET) was developed as a central information repository for strategic and up-to-date information of public and private transport, able to present and analyze information from different perspectives and serve multiple purposes



The main objective is to meet the needs of planning and development, research and statistics, and regulations in public and private transport timely which will provide accurate information resource and a holistic approach that supports decision-making at the middle and operational levels



Roles and Responsibilities:

• Project Management, Vendor Management and support

procedures and guidelines

headline: Manager, Data Analyst at MOH Holdings Pte Ltd (Singapore)
about:
TRADE CAPTURE and POST PROCESSING team



Collaborated with counterparts in Europe and North America as a global team to support clients all around the world.

Facilitated automation of trade loading (incoming files) as well as outgoing files of Position Report for Risk valuation and Broker Instruct; Area of responsibility involved setting up configuration, mapping (SQL), liaising with development, market data, back office team and investors.

Investigated and addressed post-implementation data discrepancies (late/missing trades, incorrect values) as well as attending to ad-hoc requests, involved in new client on-boarding, data conversion & other projects.

Coached new joiner as well as be the subject matter expertise for the team.

As a senior, drove APAC team to deliver projects specially assigned by managers or directors such as risk exposure evaluation, performance measurement etc.

Efficiency driven work mindset, for example initiated to revamp technical GUI into business user-friendly in the benefit of cutting down the support turnaround time and reduced dependency on support team by creating MS.Excel macro for business user to retrieve live-to-date mapped accounts.

Translated business needs into technical requirement; communicated with various parties such business user, development, back office, brokers and clients.

Hands-on experience with database queries (Oracle & MS-SQL), autosys commands, ticketing system Unicenter Service Desk, support document creation in SharePoint, Confluence as well as development issue management JIRA.

Had sense of urgency, details on data, timely project follow-up, delivery within expectation, self-manage and self-initiate.

headline: Data Analyst at GovTech Singapore
about:
● Performed extraction and cleaning of data (Google Analytics/DoubleClick/BigQuery) for multiple campaigns.



● Analyzed the effectiveness of different media touchpoints in the customer journey for identified campaigns by allocating contribution values to the touchpoints through Attribution Modeling (Probabilistic Methods/Logistic Regression/ Markov-Chains).



● Optimized allocation of media budget based on effectiveness of media touchpoints and budget constraints.



● Created interactive visualizations using D3.js to help media team convey to clients how different touchpoints contribute to conversions in different customer journeys.



● Automated daily ingestion of DoubleClick Data Transfer Files stored in Google Cloud Storage into Data Warehouse (BigQuery) enabling data to be persisted and allowed multi-user access to slice and dice data required for various campaign analysis.



● Kick start the development of big data capabilities within the team to allow more efficient data processing and modelling.



Tools:

Python, Google Analytics, Google DoubleClick, Google BigQuery, Spark, Tableau, Excel (Pivot/Solvers)

headline: Data Science at Unilever
about:
- Developed an automated regression-based modeling approach (using R) on >10 million rows of transaction data to predict sales in Vietnam, identifying €4.3M in sales opportunities; engaged non-technical stakeholders to gain buy-in for model and to iterate with to improve model accuracy

- Built dashboards (using Tableau) to provide more granular visibility into operational trade spend investments in the Philippines; engaged stakeholders in gathering business requirements, iterating on dashboard designs, and running analyses

- Wrote scripts (using Python) to automate back-end data processing for an internal cognitive computing platform; designed the data pipeline to scale data ingestion (to handle >50 million rows of data)

- Created a self-serve web app (using R and Shiny) to allow Indonesia business users to upload transaction data, view descriptive analytics, and run association rule mining to guide promotion planning

headline: Data Analyst (Graduate Program) - Cognizant Technology Solutions
about:
Wan Theng is a recent graduate from Singapore Management University, double majoring in Marketing and Analytics and has a major interest in analytics, digital marketing and technology.



Wan Theng enjoys gaining new experiences and knowledge and this can be identified in the myriad of activities she has participated. Ranging from taking on leadership positions in organising committees for different kinds of sporting and school events, to volunteering for different courses and expanding her personal experience as a Volunteer Analyst for NCSS.

To gain experiences in her field of interests in technology and analytics, Wan Theng has interned as a Digital Marketer and Analyst for start-ups, high-tech firms as well as in the healthcare sector. To further challenge herself, she has also participated in numerous competitions such as the Nielsen Case Competition twice and successfully clinched first in the Social Innovation Challenge.



Lastly, being an inquisitive and hungry learner, Wan Theng is actively looking to learn new things, gain new knowledge and try new things. She actively reads up on new and interesting facts and self-learns new skills in her field of interests.

She is passionate in solving first world problems of marketers (such as increasing ROI, targeting the right customer with the right channel, and retargeting strategy) and content manager (such as content angle and readability). She is self-starter who has lots of initiatives and "get-it-done" attitude. She loves working in a smart, dynamic, and open-minded team who has the same passion to solve real world problems.

headline: Data Analyst at Citibank NA
about:
 I am a bright talented and self-motivated data analyst, who has excellent organizational skills, is highly efficient and has a good eye for detail analysis.

 Over 8.5 years of IT experience in the field of Business/Data analysis, ETL Development and Data Modeling.

 Ability to collaborate with peers in both, business, and technical areas, to deliver optimal business process solutions, in line with corporate priorities.

 Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) experience including Requirements, Specifications Analysis/Design and Testing as per the Software Development Life Cycle.

 Expertise in analysis and review of Software and Business Requirement documents.

 Experience in Leading team and Managing project of small and big size.

Also recently as part of this module, we have re-designed the Project One Private Bank Statement redesign. This was the complete re-design of the previous private bank statement to a brand new format to cater the latest client expectations with more information and simple design.
In the latest statement re-design project, I involved in most of the phases like Requirement Analysis, Business data Analysis, Design, UAT Testing and production implementation. I was providing solutions and suggestions which was pretty much appreciated by the client manager and also mentioned in the feedback. Later also helped to analyze and resolve the client queries and production issues. Also I raised new change requests for the enhancements.

Responsibilities:
 Responsible for loading, extracting and validation of client data.
 Analyzing raw data, drawing conclusions & developing recommendations
 Writing new requirements, change requests, production issue analysis and raising tickets if required.
 Requirement Analysis, Static testing, Query Tracker, Client meetings.
 Liaising with end-users and 3rd party suppliers.

headline: Data Analyst
about:
I am a graduate from the University at Buffalo with a Masters in Communication, specializing in quantitative research methods. My research interests stem from my work experience in the application of data analytics in business scenarios, where trends and relationships are used to derive actionable insights that lead to data driven decisions and preferred outcomes.



I am an independent worker, and possess effective communication and inter-personal skills. I enjoy challenges that engage my analytical mind, as well as taking on leadership roles in projects. I believe that grit, resourcefulness, and attention to detail are important in a role of R&D.

headline: Data Product Manager at Mobilewalla
about:
Masters in Data Analytics at Singapore Management University

5+ years of work experience in IT industry

Familiarity with relational databases and SQL-like query languages

Knowledge of a scientific computing language such as R, Python and visualization tools such as Tableau

Ability to analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources

Analytics modelling and algorithms to derive actionable insights from data

Well versed with Software development life cycle including Agile methodologies

Demonstrated leadership and communication skills by leading small sized teams

Ability to work on parallel projects which would benefit the team and product in terms of time and cost

Self-starter, action oriented and possess strong Technical and communication skills



Technical Skills:

=================

Scripting languages: Python, R, SQL

Tools: SAS-EM, JMP, Tableau, ArcMap Esri, Bizagi, MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS SharePoint

Exposure to Hadoop, MapReduce

Understanding of Analytics in Business Context eg: Telco, Retail, IT, Supply Chain



Analytics techniques:

=====================

Exploratory Data and Descriptive Analysis

Predictive Modelling: Discriminant analysis, Recursive Partitioning such as Decision Trees and BootStrap Forest

Customer Analytics such as Market Basket, Segmentation and Profiling

Variable reduction techniques: PCA and cluster analysis

Regression Modelling: Linear and Logistics

Text Analytics - Clustering, Classification, Topic modelling, Information Retrieval

Social Network Analytics - Centrality measures, Network Statistics

Operations Analytics - EOQ, Queuing and Simulation



Finance Modules

==============

Financial and Management Accounting

Finance for T&O Managers

headline: Data Analyst at Study Group
about:
• Extensively gather requirements from all users, experts, and key personnel to understand the current functionality of the existing system.

• Understanding the data mining analyses that help detect consumer behavioral patterns.

• Communicate and interact on a regular basis with the project manager and development team during different stages of the project.

• Create and conduct quality control checks on data from initial delivery from data processing to final analysis results in order to ensure the accuracy of reports.

• Ensure all client deliverables meet client expectations in terms of scope, speed & quality.

• Managed schedules and collaborated with different teams working on the project.

• Assist the business partners with different kinds of ad-hoc requests from time to time.

headline: Senior Data Analyst, Data Analytics at FIGS INC
about:
Compilation, restructuring, analysis and effective utilization of big data has always been an endemic problem faced by organizations and industry stakeholders alike. This issue has always given rise to the need for specialized professionals to serve as the processing units between raw information and usable data. I pride myself in being identified as a data scientist or data analyst as we all know it.



I assist organizations develop an understanding of several concepts not limited to customer behavior, demographics and life cycle by using quantitative data which helps influence key decisions at the top management table while improving products and services by utilizing advanced analytics, standing up big data tools, creating and maintaining models, and onboarding compelling new data sets.



Currently, I lead the Data Analytics team at Figs Inc. Pte Ltd. Where I conceptualize, design and program financial models that translate complex financial data into simplified information that retail investors can accurately comprehend.



Throughout my professional career I have maintained the highest standards of professionalism and integrity within a wide range of different roles. One of my key strengths is my ability to invest time to understand the needs of an organization and to provide tailored solutions to various problems. Over time, I have developed the ability to establish and maintain professional working relationships with a wide variety of individuals and cross-functional teams.

headline: Data Analyst at HOOQ
about:
As a graduate of Mathematics and Economics, Alson is comfortable with numbers and enjoys solving complex problems. Being always curious and inquisitive, coupled with knowledge in statistics, regression and programming, makes the role of a data analyst/scientist a great fit for Alson.



Alson has had experience in data analysis work - uncovering insights, data visualizations and recommending actionable insights. This is a field that he has great passion for and wish to pursue fervently in. As there is still much to learn and technology is constantly changing, he keeps himself abreast of developments in this field and constantly improve his skills via MOOCs and competing in Kaggle competitions.



Please feel free to connect and contact at alsonyap185@gmail.com

headline: Data Analyst | Python | SAS
about:
Passionate about data science and currently working as a Data Analyst. Working with various public agencies to improve their data systems and upgrade into the field of data analytics and business intelligence. Proficient in Python, SAS and SQL. Enjoys learning and doing interesting data projects including machine learning, natural language processing and implementing interesting dashboards.



Feel free to check out my Github account for my projects, message me or request for my resume!



Github: http://github.com/kohjiaxuan (Projects links below and in Accomplishment - Projects section)



1. Natural Language Processing (NLP) Model to determine similarity of two Wikipedia Articles

https://github.com/kohjiaxuan/NLP-Model-for-Corpus-Similarity/



2. Data Science Competition by SAS Institute (1st place)

The project challenged teams to gather novel insights and come up with innovative ways to increase the revenue of a Japanese e-commerce company (Ponpare). Models used: k-means Clustering, Market Basket Analysis (MBA) and Decision Trees



3. Wikipedia Scraper and Text Analytics Python Package

https://github.com/kohjiaxuan/Wikipedia-Article-Scraper/



4. Predicting price of HDB Resale Flats using machine learning. Best Model: Random Forest & XGBoost. RMSE is 18.5% of the base mean price model, 80% of predicted prices had difference of $30,000 or below with actual sales price.

https://github.com/kohjiaxuan/Predicting-HDB-Price-with-Machine-Learning



5. Visualisation of Gradient Descent Algorithm for Machine Learning

https://github.com/kohjiaxuan/Visualisation-of-Gradient-Descent/



6. Stock Market Dashboard using live API

https://github.com/kohjiaxuan/Stock-Market-Dashboard

🗸 Conducted text analytics of cash amounts mentioned, named entity chunking and extraction, and phrase detection in unstructured text data which is used for fraud detection and alert generation, greatly reducing time taken to read lengthy documents and news articles

headline: Business Analytics Analyst at Citi
about:
At Shopee, I am engaged in user behaviour analysis and working closely with Product Managers to enhance the product features as well as improve user experiences continuously with data-driven solutions across SEA and Taiwan markets. I deal with big data solutions and tools like Spark, Hive and Presto to handle ever-escalating data volume and solve complex business problems.



Equipped with strong statistical analysis and modeling skills, I am genuinely passionate about data analytics and technology. For final year project, I developed the statistical models to handle data truncation associated with physical activity data in public health studies. Besides, I am proficient in programming languages and analysis tools such as Excel VBA, R, Matlab, Python and SQL. As Data Analytics Intern at Canon Singapore, I have developed a business analysis tool to visualize the historical business trends across regions and products as well as facilitate the decision making at the divisional level. Despite unfamiliarity with organization’s business models and data structures, I worked closely with the team, learned the business needs and requirements from the internal stakeholders and completed the project which was nominated for Breakthrough Award within 5 weeks.



I am a self-driven team player, who aspires to improve the processes through digitalization and automation, implement the changes and solve the business challenges in the ever-changing environment.



My peers know me as a team-oriented individual who always put the team's interest first. I can (and often do) work well individually, but I am at my best collaborating with others. I do my best work when I'm challenged and empowered to take the ownership of the tasks.

headline: | Data Analyst | Business Analyst | IT Systems Analyst | Computational Analytics |
about:
My name is Harul and I currently work with the Land Transport Authority of Singapore as an Executive IT Systems Analyst managing a suite of IT projects dealing with Big Data IT Infrastructure and Data Analytics. Having built my long career of over a dozen years with over 9 years of mid-management experience in handling team operations and administrative functions in the public and private sectors and over 3 years of experience in the IT industry in social media analytics, software engineering and project management and having self-funded both my degrees at my own expense, I have had personally experienced and overcame various challenges of financial constraint, social discrimination and degenerative belief systems of success both at home and in society.



The sum total of all these experiences was humbling and had given me excellent leadership and team management skills with a personal credo that “true leaders don’t just inspire to galvanise hordes of followers, but act to create great leaders out of their inspired followers”. In leading teams, I see potential over weakness, engagement over authority and support over neglect in my teams.



Being a leader, I am fervently passionate to learn and grow beyond the confines of my professional knowledge and a firm believer that one has to acquire proper training or knowledge by any means possible to deliver to the fullest of one’s ability of the task in any job. As a systems analyst, I am highly trained and skilled in implementing, evaluating technical and functional aspects in IT project deliverables. I am also highly proficient in presenting and explaining technical reports and project updates in both functional and technical capacities to C-suite leaders and team members. I also possess sound theoretical and practical knowledge in computer science, neuroeconomics, marketing, public policy, information science, communications, strategy and business management and look forward to running my own enterprise one day.

headline: Senior Data Analyst at 99.co |Past: foodpanda Grab Uber Citi
about:
I work on business intelligence and analytics at 99.co.



I’ve spent 2 years in food delivery, between being in charge of Marketplace Efficiency in Uber Eats Singapore, to being acquired by Grab to launch Grab Food, then leaving post-launch for a regional analytics role in foodpanda (small ‘f’).



Prior to that, I cut my teeth in Citi for 3 years, where I was part of the Decision Management team doing data analytics for the Global Consumer Bank. My core responsibility was in sales incentive analytics and small-medium business banking analytics. In that role, my primary tools for data analysis were SAS, SQL, and VBA.

[{'title': 'Senior Data Analyst', 'company': '99.co', 'duation_date': 'Sep 2019 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 mo', 'description': 'Nil'}, {'title': 'Regional Business Intelligence Analyst (APAC)', 'company': 'foodpanda', 'duation_date': 'Sep 2018 – Aug 2019', 'duration_length': '1 yr', 'description': 'I worked on regional analytics projects in foodpanda (small ‘f’) across APAC. Key achievements:

- Map-based visualization of key operations and logistics metrics using Python and Tableau - helped operations managers cut order failure rates by as much as 90% in some zones

- Regional DWH migration - supported analysts across 8 countries in preparing for a global DWH migration to Redshift from PostgreSQL

- Regional Tableau Adoption - Onboarded 8 analysts across several countries to Tableau and coached them to replicate their reporting on Tableau as opposed to Excel and Google Sheets See less'}, {'title': 'Strategy, Planning & Analysis Associate', 'company': 'Grab', 'duation_date': 'Apr 2018 – Sep 2018', 'duration_length': '6 mos', 'description': 'Post the Uber acquisition in Southeast Asia, I worked on the Grab Food launch in Singapore.'}, {'title': 'Operations Associate', 'company': 'Uber', 'duation_date': 'Dec 2017 – May 2018', 'duration_length': '6 mos', 'description': 'I was responsible for Marketplace Efficiency for Uber Eats Singapore, running experiments to optimize pricing, spend, courier positioning, and dispatching. Key achievements:

- Optimized weekly incentives for couriers to push part-timers to become full-timers, resulting in a massive increase in full-time supply in a previously sparse cohort while maintaining cost neutrality over a 5-week period

- Analysed the UberEats Marketplace Supply-Demand pattern to inform geo and time targeted incentives, achieving supply utilization targets for both over and under supplied geos

- Optimized courier positioning and reliability through creating a real-time restaurant delivery radius optimization engine, and crafting courier positioning communications. These initiatives halved the number of undelivered orders attributed to poor supply positioning measured over a 6-week period. See less'}, {'title': 'Business Analyst', 'company': 'Citi', 'duation_date': 'Apr 2015 – Dec 2017', 'duration_length': '2 yrs 9 mos', 'description': "My core work areas were running the Sales Incentive Programme for all non-branch sales channels in Singapore and offshore, and providing analytical support to CitiBusiness, Citi’s SME banking arm.

Key Contributions:
- Started and led the Loan Adjustment Portal project to streamline the loan dispute process between sales channels and creating a clean data source for sales analysis. Received a nomination for the CEO award for Radical Simplification. Project saves over 200 man-hours monthly at the frontline.

- Created a user friendly platform to collect data from relationship managers regarding their calls and appointments. This eliminated the labourious process of bankers sending information about their appointments to service staff to manually key into a centralized tracker. Further, it gives excellent visibility on sales activity and creates a reliable data source for customer journey analysis. Won the Earth Mover Award from the CEO of Citibank Singapore (see picture) for this project.

- Identified a fresh customer target segment for an existing product creating sales leads that generate revenue amounting to over $2MM over a 12 month period

- Automated daily sales report generation for the retail bank, including data pull from multiple sources to create dashboards for senior management, sales management, and frontline bankers.

- Halved the number of steps required in the CitiBusiness Sales Incentive Process to dramatically improve responsiveness to the sales team and turnaround time to management.

Produced and directed a show which won Citi's Got Talent 2016, an internal talent contest. See less"}]

headline: Regional Data Analyst at Publicis Media
about:
3+ years of experience in consulting, costumer segmentation analysis, strategy planning, insights generation and data driven decision making for one of the top fortune 50 companies. I have a strong performance history in modelling, dashboard building, data visualization, insight generation and in exceeding client expectations by understanding their business needs.

I am always striving to bring 100% to the work that I do, and my goal as a data consultant is to build strong, long term, mutually beneficial relationships with the clients by truly partnering with them and understanding their business needs.

I hold a Masters’ degree in Economics (with specialization in World Economy) from Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi (Ranked 2nd amongst all Indian Universities according to NIRF).

headline: Data Analyst at GoBear
about:
I am specialized in machine learning algorithms and artificial intelligence technology to build scalable data platform, coupled with the ability to communicate findings to both business and IT in a way that solve business problems and improve products' performance.



I have hands-on experience in working in cross-function teams and delivering work across various products. I have acquired excellent analytical, information gathering, problem-solving and issue detecting skills. My proficient use of Google analytics, R, and SQL has helped me complete the work effectively and efficiently.



I am a highly motivated and optimistic individual who is very outgoing and passionate. My interest lies in extracting value from the data to better serve the business. I am always keen on learning new knowledge and skills to prepare myself better for the challenging work environment.

headline: Data Scientist | Urbanist
about:
I write code, to study data, to understand behavior. I believe in clear, simple communication of methods and results, and I engage myself at every stage of the business or research process, from people to models.



I'm experienced in defining problems to direct studies related to urban behavior, such as transport, public health, and public discourse. I'm also capable in data project management at all levels, from business strategy, to software development cycles, domain knowledge research, data exploration and modelling.



My long term goal is to apply myself to architecture and urban masterplanning. The endgame is to empower communities and individuals with knowledge that can help them engineer their own behavior.

headline: Data Analyst at Cognizant
about:
Graduate Program (Classroom and On-Job Training)

1. Data visualisation tools to present data, Qliksense, QlikView and Tableau

2. Implementing Data-warehousing and ETL concepts

3. Managing database and analytics using Teradata and SQL

4. Ordering, Scheduling and monitoring Control-M jobs (BMC Software)



Client: OCBC Bank, Singapore (Sept 2018 - present)

1. Python UDM Project

• Learnt about flow of data in data marts and the need for closing inactive records.

• Regression testing, data validation and backtracking programs to determine data inconsistency.

• Knowledge of Teradata, Unix scripts, DataStage and control M.

• Contributed to Python SIT through test cases and preparing mapping documents.

• Generation .Tar files and deploying them in respective environments



2. ITSR Team

• Introduced to ITSR projects and the concepts of understanding user requirements, preparing impact analysis and executing the steps needed to complete a project.

• With the aid of the team, analyse source systems and tables to provide solutions as per requirements.

• Design mapping and logic between source and target systems by applying EDW concepts.

• Experience in development, System integration testing, User acceptance testing and regression testing.

• Maintenance and creation of mapping documents.

headline: Data Analytics | Machine Learning | Optimization
about:
* Data preparation for data modelling, data interpretation and generation of insights for Marketing,

Commercial Planning & Research (CPR) and Asia Pacific GMNC (AP GMNC) teams.

* Work with the above mentioned teams to provide insights on customer transactional data in support of development of marketing programmes and sales planning.



Projects with the Marketing team (Aug 2017 - Nov 2017)

* On Demand Delivery (ODD) prediction using classification analysis.

* Sales report analysis to identify the lapse customers in Singapore.

* Propensity model for DHL Shipping Insurance to support the marketing campaigns.



Projects with the CPR team

Dec 2017 - Mar 2018

* Monthly Revenue Forecasting and Revenue per Day (RpD) forecasting at country level. to help the CPR team with sales planning for the various sales teams covering the Singapore market.



Feb 2018 - Apr 2018

* Revenue discrepancy analysis at account & AWB level in Daily Sales Data (DSD).

* Streamlined DSD in the sales database which was subsequently used for Business Performance

Tracker.



May 2018 - July 2018

headline: Data Analyst | NUS Business Analytics Masters
about:
“I’m a bit of a freak for evidence-based analysis. I strongly believe in data.”



A former BI Associate Consultant with Infosys in India. While at Infosys, I worked with Tech Clients, helping them in channelizing the data-stream, detailing the ETL workflow, target marketing, market analysis and opportunity assessment, report automation and dashboard designing.



Currently, I am a full-time Masters in Enterprise Business Analytics student at the National University of Singapore where I am learning advanced analytics, statistical and optimization techniques to derive data-driven insights and leveraging these to take smarter strategic decisions. I am learning to grow your business by driving deeper understanding through analytics and data visualizations. I figure out and present data; extracting insights for competitive advantages!



Skills: Statistical modeling, Customer analytics, Text analysis, Visualization, Web Analytics(Graph Mining), Google Analytics, Marketing Insight Modelling, Geo-spatial Analysis

Experience in SQL, R, Python, Tableau , SPSS (Modeler and Statistics), JMP, VBA, Excel solver

headline: Aspiring Data Scientist | Data Analyst, Solar Monitoring
about:
• Subject matter expert for solar photovoltaic systems' monitoring and maintenance

• Developed, implemented, and maintained a MySQL database as a data collection system for solar PV system data, for monitoring and billing purposes.

• Wrote R codes to perform data integrity checks on the data before it goes into the database, to ensure that the data is 100% dependable for data analysis and billing.

• Wrote R codes to easily transform data from one form to another, for generating data reports for other departments, or to upload data into the MySQL database.

• Used Tableau to create visualizations of solar PV system data, to quickly identify poor performing sites and subsequently recommend rectification actions.

• Lead for Sunseap’s global solar monitoring portal design project.

• Coordinated and executed rectification actions with maintenance team on underperforming solar PV systems

• Developed and prepared customized reports from databases to extract and collect data according to client or management needs

headline: Regional Strategy & Data Analyst, APAC at BSH Home Appliances Group
about:
Darryl brings clarity to the business by translating data into narratives.



He delivers meaningful insights by applying data techniques in solving complex problems, with Python as his primary choice of weapon. He has had the fortune to carry out his work on both emerging and developed markets at BSH Home Appliances, the #1 manufacturer in Europe with global brands such as Bosch, Siemens and more.



In the past two years, he has partnered stakeholders in addressing diverse topics, involving business forecasting, strategic performance, market intelligence and board support to accelerate decision-making.



That experience has been complemented well with his keen interest in further exploring the real-world applications of data science. His interest has manifested in >250 training hours across 3 courses, in just under 10 months.



Skills come and go, but his ability to learn on the fly will always be his one key resource.

—

▽ Say hello to darryl.wang.2013@smu.edu.sg

headline: 'It is not magic, it is Data Science'
about:
Someone once asked me: 'How did you make all the data appear in just a click of a button? Is it magic?'

I answered them: 'If I were a magician, you would have seen me on the television, wouldn't you?'



Highly motivated and data driven team-player with a more numerical and analytical passion. I am curious about data and am interested in creating value from data. Pursuing a Specialist Diploma in Business Analytics taught me to draw actionable insights from data, ensuring that I bring value to my team.



Outside of work, I am gearing up for the new wave of technology the world is creating. I have enrolled for data science and automation courses on Udemy to feed my curious mind. I intend to continue increasing my skillsets going forward.

headline: Data Analyst
about:
Grab is more than just the leading ride-hailing and mobile payments app in Southeast Asia. We use data and technology to improve everything from transportation to payments and logistics across a region of more than 620 million people. Working with governments, drivers, passengers, and charities, we aim to unlock the true potential of the region by solving problems that hinder progress.



Grab began as a taxi-hailing app in 2012, but has extended its product platform to include private car services (GrabCar & GrabShare), motorcycle taxis (GrabBike), social carpooling (GrabHitch) and last mile delivery (GrabExpress). We are focused on pioneering new commuting alternatives for drivers and passengers with an emphasis on speed, safety, and reliability. Currently we offer services in Singapore, Indonesia, Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand and Vietnam; however, we also have R&D offices in Bangalore, Beijing, & Seattle.

about:

I'm an Economics and Finance Graduate, with prior and current experience in data analytics and keen to pursue roles where I can learn and apply my data analytics skill in the business context.

I can write, edit and maintain SQL scripts and I am also keen to explore further in areas such as R, python etc.

✅ Manage procurement and cancellation of market data services.
✅ Interact with external vendors and users to ensure effectiveness in helping users get their market data subscriptions up and running within the SLA guidelines

headline: Senior Data Analyst at Plano
about:
I graduated with a degree in Biotechnology (from NUS in 2001) ,Advanced diploma in Pharamceutical management (from MDIS in 2007) and Masters in Education (from NTU in 2013). I have 8 years experience of teaching biology at O and A levels/ IB level in international schools in Singapore and overseas. My expertise in Biology include genetics, biochemistry and bioinformatics (Rbioconductor)



In 2014, i ventured into Data Analytics and Database Management and i picked up Statistics/Machine Learning, BigData analytics, textmining & social media analytics and web applications. My main data science programming languages are R and Python. My interest is also in deep learning using sequential models and sequence to sequence models using Keras and h2oAI deep learning platforms and libraries.

I also do Business Analytics and apps using Microsoft suite of tools including PowerBI, Flow, PowerApps and Azure ML studio. I am also proficient in Tableau.



I am now an adjust lecturer/trainer at LSBF (London school of Business & Finance) & TertiaryCourses for programming, data analytics/visualization and machine/deep learning including R, RapidMiner, DeepCognition, Tableau and Advanced Excel.



In Nov 2018, I started working for Plano pte ltd. as a Senior Data Analyst, where i perform data analytics and create predictive models using healthcare data.



My resume is at: https://tinyurl.com/dwightresume

- Led the Baseline Project to help multiple BUs in forecasting day-to-day digital performance against their annual KPI.

headline: Head of Data Science at Shopee
about:
Dr. Pan Yaozhang is the head of data science, leading the data science team at Shopee, the e-commerce platform of SEA group. She has built the data science team for Shopee from scratch and grew the team to a strong data science team with 60+ full-time data scientists and 10+ data science interns. She is committed to introducing the most advanced technologies of machine learning and artificial intelligence into industrial and commercial applications.



Prior to that, she has worked for South-East Asia's largest ride-hailing platform: Grab, and a US start-up IoT company: Greenwave Systems. Before joining the industrial world, she was a research scientist at Institute for Infocomm Research, A*STAR, focus on research and applications of machine learning and brain-computer interface.



Due to the first line team management experiences in these top internet companies of Singapore, she understands deeply about how to build and manage a technical team and gains thorough knowledge about the technology development and the talent pool of South East Asia, especially in Big Data and AI areas, such as Machine Learning/Deep learning, Natural language processing, Computer Vision, etc.



Professional Highlights:

- Experienced in the senior leadership role, led a data science team in Grab; built from scratch and leading the data science team for e-commerce at Shopee, SEA.

- Strategic planning, Hiring and recruitment, People Management, Leadership

- Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing, Optimization

- Data Architecture, Big data tools and platforms: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Pig, Impala, etc.

- Advanced Data Analytics, Data Governance, Data Performance Management

- Python, R, MATLAB, and Tableau
experiences:
[{'title': 'Head of Data Science', 'company': 'Shopee', 'duation_date': 'Jul 2018 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 yr 3 mos', 'description': 'Roadmap planning and execution 
• Plan technology roadmap, communicate across different functions,
• Identify business-wide problems and executed critical data science projects
• Our data science projects cover all major AI areas: Nature Language Processing, Computer Vision, Image Processing, Knowledge Graph, Deep Learning

Manpower planning, talent sourcing
• Building a top data science team from scratch up to 60+ full-time data scientists and 10+ data science interns.
• Initiated collaborations with Universities and data science communities, co-organized several meetup and machine learning competitions, attracted 200-300 talents each time.

We are hiring data scientist and machine learning engineer, feel free to reach out!'}, {'title': 'Manager, Data Science Lead', 'company': 'Shopee', 'duation_date': 'Oct 2016 – Jun 2018', 'duration_length': '1 yr 9 mos', 'description': 'Leading the data science team with 30+ team members for the E-commerce Business of SEA'}, {'title': 'Data Science Lead', 'company': 'Grab(formerly GrabTaxi)', 'duation_date': 'May 2015 – Oct 2016', 'duration_length': '1 yr 6 mos', 'description': "● Identify business-wide problems and lead junior data scientists in solving them using a combination of Big-data, Machine Learning (ML), and/or Operations Research (OR) techniques.
● Initiate, plan, and execute multiple projects. Work across different functions in the business.
● Communicate problem formulation, solution, analyses and insights to team members and stakeholders.

Selected Projects:
Grabshare
One of the milestones I achieved in Grab. I was in charge of the matching algorithm design and worked as data owner in this top priority project.
The GrabShare service pairs just two passenger bookings with similar trip routes within a single trip. We use optimization technologies to make the GrabShare's matching algorithm ensures passengers get to their destinations in the shortest possible time.

POI (place of interest) Ranking
Designed and deployed a search ranking algorithm, which increased top 1 hit accuracy from 30% to 70%, top 5 hit accuracy from 70% to 97%.
See less"}, {'title': 'Research Scientist', 'company': 'GreenWave Systems Inc', 'duation_date': 'Feb 2014 – Apr 2015', 'duration_length': '1 yr 3 mos', 'description': 'Work as a research scientist who is exploring and developing all kinds of new technologies and innovations, specially focus on developing cloud analytics stack and applications of cloud analytics.

Some of my works at Greenwave Systems, with analytics being the most recent:

Data Analytics - Hadoop, Mahout, Hive, Impala, Cassandra, Spark, Shark
- Simulation and cost optimization of home heating and cooling systems.
- Recommendation system for advocating energy monitoring and management in homes.

Projects:
Smart Heating:
This project relates to cost optimization for premises that are equipped with electrical heating or cooling systems for regulating indoor temperatures. The cost of electricity varies by the hour (or other units of time) and such price schedules are published by the utility company a day ahead, or at least prior to when our cost optimization calculation is performed. We explore how two variables can affect the costs of heating/cooling: target temperate and start-time of heating/cooling, and present various scenarios to the occupant to optimize the heat pump setting that gain a good balance between energy saving and comfort. Analytic stacks that used in this project including Hadoop, impala, hive etc.

Solar Panel:
This project focus on fault detection of solar panel. We keep monitoring the power output of solar panel and based on the output data to analyze and identify the situation and fault of solar panel. For example, snow lowers power output from the solar panel. Individual panels can fail, wiring can break,
inverter can fail – all leading to lowered or zero output of solar panel. If solar panel output low and weather forecast snow, it probably snow. If the weather is good but the power is low, the problem is probably with wiring. If the power consistently low, then maybe 1 or more panels failed. Analytic stacks that used in this project including Hadoop, hive etc. See less'}, {'title': 'Scientist', 'company': 'Institute for Infocomm Research', 'duation_date': 'Dec 2010 – Feb 2014', 'duration_length': '3 yrs 3 mos', 'description': 'Research on EEG signal processing, machine learning, brain-computer interface etc. Worked on projects helping stroke and epilepsy patients:

iSLEEP:
through a novel brainwave analysis method, developing a system which is able to continuously play back the most suitable music that can help the user enter sleep, in real time, according to the person’s brain status. The system is able to help people enter sleep quickly and easily, therefore improving their quality of sleep. I am the technical leader of this project and focused on the brainwave-music response modeling; MATLAB code implementation; inventive steps
development; system performance validation; technical documentation, etc.

iMUSIC:
providing a brand new music sorting mechanism which automatically and intuitively selects a piece of music or ranks a music playlist according to the listener’s emotional information from brainwaves, derived from a real-time Brain Computer Interface (BCI). I am the technical leader of this project and focused on designing the neural signal processing methods, Matlab implementation of signal processing codes, technical documentation, and experimental analysis, etc.

SEIZE:
Automated video-EEG analytic system in seizure detection in the Epilepsy Monitoring Unit, 01 Feb 2010 - 30 Sep 2012. As an expert in seizure detection using EEG signal, I focused on analyzing long-term EEG signal and build the machine learning algorithm to automatically detect both general and focal seizures and localize the focal seizures.

ArtsBCI:
Advanced rehabilitation therapy for stroke based on Brain-Computer Interface, 01 Feb 2010 - 30 Sep 2012. I worked on fMRI image investigations based on pattern recognition methods to evaluate the effect of BCI based rehabilitation for stroke patients.
See less'}]

headline: Data Analyst Intern at Bloomberg LP
about:
I am a university student, currently in the final year of an inter disciplinary degree, Business Analytics at the National University of Singapore. Be it spending a month interning in the analytics team in Nokia, or working on creating an app in the field of nutrition or spending a month in Fiji working under an Australian company, Project Everest, trying to use artificial intelligence and various data collecting methods using drones to help Fijian farmers as part of a social enterprise, I have always wanted to challenge myself to try new things.



Along with my various work experiences and internships, I would not be a complete person without two things - arts and adventure. Be it being a child artist in various drama shows, debating at a National level in my secondary school, being part of the choir for 4 years, learning the keyboard under Trinity guildhall for 8 years, getting trained in classical Indian dance or getting one of my short stories published when I was 16, I am a true admirer the arts. Also, being an adrenaline junkie, I would go to any extent to try the most extreme and uncomfortable activities, just for the experience. Some examples would be my attempt at the world's tallest bungee jump in Macau, despite my fear of heights, or my one month of living alone in one of India's most unsafe city for women.



To summarize me in one line - I am a thrill seeker, with an immense passion for the arts and new experiences that push me out of my comfort zone.

headline: MS Business Analytics Candidate | Data Analyst | Pharmacist | SG:Digital Scholar
about:
Healthcare data analyst and senior pharmacist with demonstrated hospital experience (a hybrid of data and drugs), currently pursuing Masters of Science in Business Analytics at NUS. Avid learner and dedicated doer with track record of award-winning ground-up healthcare projects. Enterprising character with strong interest in leveraging data and digital innovation in healthcare to empower patients and fellow healthcare professionals. Registered pharmacist in both Singapore and Hong Kong.



== Engagements ==

✔ Host/Speaker - e2i Medical Technologies Seminar (Healthcare Analytics) 2019

✔ Speaker/Panelist - Pharmaceutical Society of Singapore - Leadership Forum in IT and Innovation 2019

✔ Speaker/Panelist - Singapore Pharmacy Congress 2018 (Pharmacy Technology Workshop)

✔ Speaker - Bayer-NUS Enterprise Grants4apps Singapore Roadshow 2017 (Medication Adherence)

headline: Data Analyst
about:
I’m currently on a personal recharge and am at the moment looking out for job opportunities in a data driven team at an organisation that deals with high volume of data on a daily basis. I am also open to discussion for other opportunities where my profile/ experience might be a good fit for your organisation.



I am an experienced data analyst and during my recharge, I’ve recently completed several online courses on SQL, Python and TensorFlow.



While I majored in Economics and Finances, I am an engineer at heart. I find joy is figuring out how things work and problem solving. I have a passion for designing process that yields maximum results.



Specialist Diploma in Business Analytics: Projects with video walkthrough (see below)

- Dashboard walkthrough

- Text Mining video walkthrough

headline: Data Analyst
about:
As a data enthusiast, I have led and completed end-to-end delivery of 7 business intelligence projects within 10 months to support long-term strategic decision making, which helped the business reduced operating costs by 20%. This includes, but not limited to data scraping, data transformation, descriptive statistics, clickstream analysis, text mining, exploratory and explanatory analysis. I'm also familiar with Python, SQL, R and have experience with Hadoop.⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⠀⠀⠀



With over 6 years of industry experience (5+ years in business analytics, software and data engineering), I'm someone who isn't afraid to juggle and multi-task, hit tight deadlines, and learn new stuffs. I love to build a "story" with data and leverage on the "intelligence" to drive strategic outcomes. Talk to me if you want to learn more ;-)

headline: Data Engineer
about:
-Provide analytical support to Revenue Management department's director by giving weekly

price forecasts for 6000 markets that the airline is operating.



-Using R, Apache Spark and Amazon Web service to clean and analyze huge data sets,some of which may have 7 million rows.



-Building machine learning models to uncover the underlying strutures of the data.



-Evaluate the effectiveness of all the models by testing it out on 5 years of historical data. One

requirement is that the forecasted prices can not be 10% greater or lower than the actual prices.



-Perform Monte Carlo simulations and scenario analysis to see how the prices should change

when other inputs change.



-Currently building an application in R Studio& Shinny, which can be reused and is able to give

daily real time forecasts in a rapid manner.

headline: Data Analyst, Data Solutions at Dow Jones
about:
• Co-managing an Anti-Money Laundering (AML) name screening project since Aug 2017

• Working on multiple AML screening projects on-site at client’s offices concurrently

• Performs AML risk-based review and analysis on individual and business accounts who match with Dow Jones Sanctions, Politically Exposed Persons and Adverse Media name lists

• Comparing profiles of name matches by using documents found in clients’ internal systems, Dow Jones RiskCenter, Factiva articles and conducting external research to identify and escalate hits which require further review by clients

• Identifying and closing false hits based on various identifiers and AML methodologies

• Quality check on AML analyses done by other Data Analysts to ensure hits are decisioned correctly and are in accordance with clients’ regulatory requirements

• Training of new joiners to the team in AML methodologies and workflow processes

headline: Data & Analytics Practice Director at KMS Solutions, Inc.
about:
I am currently actively looking for new opportunity across Asia, I am based in Singapore but I can also relocate myself easily within a month.

I have been leading Data analytics for APAC (India, UAE, Singapore, Hong Kong, Philippines, Malaysia, Thailand), South Africa, Mexico and leading market search on 180 countries for business expansion.

I have experience to present insight to improve customer acquisition (web and Mobile), customer behavior, customer retention and analyse new markets for expansion.

I have been working with VP/SVP level, digital marketing, product management and sales as stakeholders.

I have gained lots of knowledge into web marketing, campaign management and customer behaviours in APAC, Europe and South America.



As I am curious I have good ability to understand new business and to analyse it.

I have large experience in Data Analytics, CRM / ERP , Business Intelligence within various competitive industry.

Beside I love sports, such as judo, hockey, rugby, surfing,where they bring me great value. And a good video game can easily keep me busy :)



I am easy going, good sense of humor, curious, very enthusiast in front of new challenges, I am not scared to go extra miles in my work and open to new culture.

I look forward to hearing back from you.

you can contact me at dvelly@gmail.com

headline: Aspiring Data Analyst || Master of IT in Business (Analytics)
about:
I am currently enrolled in the Masters of IT in Business (Analytics track) programme of Singapore Management University. As a recipient of the Ministry of Health Holdings Healthcare Graduate Studies Award, I aspire to contribute to the healthcare sector through applying my analytical skills to derive meaningful insights from the wealth of healthcare data.



I previously graduated from Nanyang Technological University with a Bachelor of Science (Biological Sciences). I was then enrolled in NTU's liberal arts programme, the University Scholars Programme, where I served as the Special Projects Director in 2015/6.



In my spare time, I enjoy reading non-fiction books, and dabbling in hand-lettering and watercolour painting. I also enjoy playing floorball, and competed in the Singapore Floorball League to win the Ladies Division 2 Championship twice.
experiences:
[{'title': 'Data Analytics Intern', 'company': 'Ministry of Health Holdings', 'duation_date': 'Jan 2019 – Jun 2019', 'duration_length': '6 mos', 'description': 'As a part of the Data Analytics Unit in the Group Internal Audit department of MOHH, the team focuses on how we can contribute towards deriving meaningful audit findings in the growing volumes of data in the public healthcare sector, both by providing our expertise in data analytics, and growing the capabilities and improving the efficiency of the auditors in the department.

My main project was the development of a timesheet tracking system, for more than 60 auditors to log the man-hours spent on audit projects and eventual recover costs. Based on requirements gathered from the various stakeholders, I conceptualized the system, explored various options of implementation, and finally developed it from scratch using Visual Basic for Applications. I also held several training sessions for the entire department, wrote detailed user guides and conducted rigorous User Acceptance Tests to ensure that the system was reliable and user-friendly.

The system I developed has saved the company thousands of dollars in procuring an off-the-shelf Timesheet tracking tool, and significantly reduced the time required to manually compile time charges and generate reports for resource utilization and cost recovery - from days to a matter of minutes. See less'}, {'title': 'Management Intern', 'company': 'Tan Tock Seng Hospital', 'duation_date': 'Jan 2018 – Jun 2018', 'duration_length': '6 mos', 'description': 'As a Management Intern in the Operations Medicine (General Medicine) Department of TTSH, I supported the development and expansion of clinical services and wards under the GM specialty through statistical analysis of performance indicators. I scoped and proposed areas of expansion for existing clinical services based on years of historical data.

I also improved the efficiency of my project team through the creation of an automated report generator with Excel macros, and designed automated dashboards to reduce report generation time, using Oracle Business Intelligence Enterprise Edition and SQL.
See less'}, {'title': 'Intern', 'company': 'Resilieo Laboratory', 'duation_date': 'Apr 2017 – Aug 2017', 'duration_length': '5 mos', 'description': 'As an intern at the Resilieo Lab, I conduct research on the behaviour and neuronal morphology of rat models in response to stress and/or environmental enrichment.
By exploring the neurological basis of the development of stress and resilience, we are a step closer to fully understanding depression, the leading disorder of the world today, and answering the question why some people might be more resilient to stress than others. See less'}, {'title': 'Intern', 'company': 'Duke-NUS Medical School', 'duation_date': 'May 2016 – Jul 2016', 'duration_length': '3 mos', 'description': 'The Chronobiology and Sleep Laboratory (CSL) focuses on circadian rhythms and sleep patterns, answering questions such as how sleep deprivation can affect physiological and neurobehavioural performance. As an attachment student at CSL, I researched on waking ultradian rhythms in humans. The Basic Rest-Activity Cycle, reflected in REM/NREM cycles during sleep, was hypothesised to appear during waking hours as periods of rest and activity. headline: Data Scientist at Traveloka | Machine Learning and Engineering
about:
I am data scientist from statistical background with experience in both public and private sectors. I have handled data science problems of different domains, including topic modelling, privacy engineering, text classification, text generation, online personalised recommendations, etc. While I have practical experience with implementing neural networks in the textual domain, I am also familiar with deep learning models in other areas such as image and recommendations. Most of my data science and software engineering skills are self taught.



Tech skills

Proficient: Apache Spark, Python, R, SQL, Docker, Bash

Intermediate: Kubernetes, Google Cloud Platform, Apache Beam, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scala, Linux, Java

Beginner: Javascript, HTML, CSS



GitHub

https://github.com/yxtay/



Personal projects

Recommendation Models in TensorFlow: https://github.com/yxtay/recommender-tensorflow

Character RNN Text Generation: https://github.com/yxtay/char-rnn-text-generation

Live Taxis on Polymer: https://yxtay.github.io/polymer-deckgl-taxi/

Visualisation of Household Income Data of Singapore: https://yxtay.github.io/data-visualisation/household-income/

Word Prediction: https://yxtay.shinyapps.io/dsc-shiny

CLT Demo: https://yxtay.shinyapps.io/rv-clt/



Articles

Learning to Learn: https://www.challenge.gov.sg/print/level-up/learning-to-learn
experiences:
[{'title': 'Data Scientist', 'company': 'Traveloka', 'duation_date': 'Aug 2018 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 yr 2 mos', 'description': '• Developed data pipeline for search ranking on Spark to transform data and train distributed models on large scale data of 200m+ exposure and conversion events per month
• Extensive use of Google Cloud Platform for end-to-end machine learning using products such as BigQuery, Datalab, Dataproc, Dataflow, Storage, Compute Engine, ML Engine and Kubernetes Engine'}, {'title': 'Data Scientist', 'company': 'Lazada Group', 'duation_date': 'Jun 2017 – Aug 2018', 'duration_length': '1 yr 3 mos', 'description': '• Developed flexible text classification pipelines using logistic regression on unigram TF-IDF and word embeddings, deployed in Docker to handle text processing and model predictions on 100k+ documents of 6 languages daily.
• Cooperated closely with Alibaba engineers over 4 months on the complete migration of Lazada data technology stack to Alibaba Cloud, requiring that I quickly pick up responsibilities and new set of tools to be able to contribute effectively.
• Refactored algorithms for realtime personalised recommendations on Lazada homepage on an inhouse web service in Java, reducing response time by 40% while maintaining performance.
• Developed and deployed a click prediction model based on logistic regression for recommendations ranking, resulting in 20% increase in click-through rates.
• Managed end-to-end development of recommendation engine, including data pipeline engineering; algorithm development and model training; testing, debugging and deployment; performance tracking and monitoring; AB testing and experimentation. See less'}, {'title': 'Junior Data Scientist', 'company': 'GovTech Singapore', 'duation_date': 'Jun 2015 – Jun 2017', 'duration_length': '2 yrs 1 mo', 'description': '• Developed an expert system on Spark for labelling diagnosis on medical documents based on officially compiled ontologies to derive the Charlson comorbidity index for patients to reduce the time spent by doctors on reviewing patient case notes.
• Used topic modelling techniques for document clustering on feedback email channels to discover themes of common issues faced by customers of a government agency and explore avenues where their service experience can be improved.
• Developed text analytics pipeline API’s to automate text preprocessing and topic modelling for use by the Citizens Feedback Analytics platform, a SaaS intended for public facing departments across the government.
• Implemented geospatial data anonymisation algorithms based on Differential Privacy from scratch in Spark Scala that is able to handle 5 billion records of GPS log data in 30 mins.
• Developed ETL pipelines in Airflow to harmonise data from numerous database tables for fraud detection graph algorithms using GraphFrame on Spark.
• Employ data science methods such as machine learning, natural language processing and visualisation to improve public service by better decision making, efficient resource allocation and understanding of users and their needs.
• Work with other government agencies to help extract actionable insights from data by understanding their requirements and formulating meaningful and measurable metrics.
• Extensive use of data science tools and software such as Python, Spark, R and Scala.'}, {'title': 'Liaison Officer', 'company': 'GovTech Singapore', 'duation_date': 'May 2016', 'duration_length': '1 mo', 'description': '• Principal Liaison Officer for the delegation of Viet Nam for the Infocomm Media Business Exchange (imbX) Ministerial Forum on ICT 2016.
• Acted according to the Protocol for handling foreign VIPs for situations including airport and hotel arrival and departure, introductions and meetings with other VIPs, networking, Welcome Dinner, etc.
• Be sensitive to and anticipated the requirements of the VIPs such as making arrangements for meetings and communicating with the driver to prepare the car ahead in time for VIP use.
• Represented as the ambassador of Singapore to ensure that the delegation are well taken care off throughout their stay from arrival to departure so that they received the best experience and enjoyed the event here.'}, {'title': 'Presiding Officer', 'company': 'GovTech Singapore', 'duation_date': 'Sep 2015', 'duration_length': '1 mo', 'description': '• Upheld the principles of Elections Officials such as neutrality and non-partisanship, voting secrecy, incorruptibility, transparency, accuracy, service to voters and professionalism.
• Set up the polling station according to an approve layout by correctly placing polling booths and properly displaying posters and signage.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Refinitiv Labs, Co-Founder DataScience SG
about: I am a senior data scientist at Refinitiv Labs (Singapore), where I focus on R&D of large-scale, cutting edge data products for the finance industry, such as anti-fraud models. In the last seven years, I worked with management, product and engineering teams across Southeast Asia, China, Europe, and the USA to deploy models that improved the experience for millions of users across finance, media, jobs marketplace, eCommerce, and healthcare. Outside of work, I co-founded DataScience SG, a data community with 9,000+ members that held 70+ meetups over the last five years. I am completing my Master of Computer Science from Georgia Tech, specializing in Interactive Intelligence. My data toolbox includes Python data stack, Scala, Java, R, SQL, TensorFlow, PyTorch & Spark.

headline: Lead Data Scientist
about:
As George Box once said 'all models are wrong, but some are useful', I am among those who are trying to find these useful models. I am an data enthusiast and lifelong learner. I enjoy solving the problems, whether they are small or big. I am studying big data analytics and different types of methodologies and algorithms supporting it. I have an interest in data science, sociology, economics and I am exploring how these fields are interdependent. Currently I am working on social network analysis and influence modelling.



Past year has been great learning experience both at academical and professional settings. I am working currently on developing data pipelines for the SMEs. And also doing freelancing for couple small projects.



Before coming to NUS for my masters, I was working as a software developer in India. I worked as a full stacked Java developer using Java, Scala, python, spring, hibernate, MySQL, Cassandra, JavaScript, HTML, spark and many other technologies.



I completed my computer engineering degree from Pune University. I was an active member of college Robotics and computer engineering. I enjoyed taking part in competitions and using my knowledge to develop a working thing.



Please feel free to reach out on LinkedIn.

Also you can connect with me on gmail: devendra.desale@gmail.com

Or my Singapore number: +65 94252533

headline: Business Analyst at Infosys Compaz Pte Ltd
about:
I'm a data enthusiast and I believe in the wonders made by data today. Very much passionate in playing around with today's vast amount of data in various vertical and horizontal domains. With profound knowledge in machine learning, data analytics and business analytics, waiting earnestly to hone and implement these skills in an organization that would help increase their productivity and business gain.



Having 4 years of professional experience which includes hands on experience specially in Python, R, Tableau, SQL, I have decided to build my career around the data science domain.

headline: Data scientist at SPRING Singapore
about: William Tjhi is an analytics practitioner with experience in both the business and technology sides of the industry. He enjoys solving practical analytics problems and understands well the science underneath. William is an expert in data mining/machine learning and proficient in statistical software, data visualization and high performance computing. He contributed to the prototyping of a national-level government analytics platform. Recently, he co-authored a book titled “R High Performance Programming”. William holds a PhD in Information Engineering from NTU Singapore. He is currently a data scientist with SPRING, advancing the use of analytics within the organisation to improve operational efficiency and cultivate data-driven decision making.

headline: Data Scientist at Grab
about:
I am working as a Data Scientist at Grab Singapore - I work on building predictive models on Geo-Spatial and temporal data using State-of-art Machine Learning techniques. I completed my dual masters in Mathematics and Computer Science from Sri Sathya Sai Institute of Higher Learning in 2017.



Prior to Grab, I worked on using Deep Learning for autonomous navigation and obstacle detection and built a simple prototype for a RC-Car and ported to ROS at Mobiliya Bangalore.



Feel free to visit my Github to checkout my work/code and interests - https://vsuriya93.github.io



I love working in Data Science, Machine Learning and Deep Learning - and of course exploring places. I am a big fan of ML meetups - and I did a workshop on using RNN/LSTM for Deep Learning in Dec 2017.
