headline: Data Scientist at Kuehne + Nagel
about: Ashok Kuruvilla Eapen works as a Regional Data Scientist at Kuehne+ Nagel Global Data Science Team. He is currently based in Singapore at their regional headquarters. His responsibilities include creating custom data science solutions for internal & external stakeholders across the globe.Previously he has worked as Data Scientist with FedEx in Singapore and Data Analytics Consultant with Cognizant in India.He has 8+ years of experience in Analytics and Information Management with a track record in Supply Chain & Insurance verticals tackling problems with data and statistics spanning the domains of AI, Causal Inference, Machine Learning, and Time-Series Forecasting. Ashok also holds a Maters in Business Analytics from National University of Singapore,Singapore.

headline: Data Scientist at Enterprise Singapore
about:
Functions

• Identify and work on analytics projects in areas involving algorithms for recommender systems, fraud analytics and 360 degree customer profile

• Build analytics prototypes and POCs to demonstrate viability and feasibility

• Work with vendor to build data pipeline architecture / data warehouse for analytics

• Level up analytics capabilities of officers in the agency to enable self-service business intelligence



Achievements

• Worked on and presented on a variant of Probabilistic Matrix Factorisation (PMF) used in a recommender system prototype for matching startups to investors at Data Science Connect

• Built a dashboard prototype presenting a 360 degree customer view to enhance productivity of ground officers

• Worked with vendor to build architecture and data pipeline for data warehouse using Pivotal Greenplum

headline: ASEAN Lead Data Scientist | Oracle Big Data & Advanced Analytics | Data Science Evangelist & Tech Mentor
about:
Janet is passionate in helping clients create value for their businesses. She does this by combining her expertise in research, consultancy, advanced analytics and IT technologies. In the course of her career, Janet has provided expert advice on data science, big data analytics, artificial intelligence, and digital transformations for companies in various industries such as telecommunications, retail, smart cities, fintech, insurance, oil & gas, and manufacturing in Asia, Central America, and Africa.



Janet started her career in Globe Telecom, a telecommunications company in the Philippines, where she participated in projects ranging from quality management system implementation to new product development.



She then became a teaching assistant at the National University of Singapore where she conducted postgraduate tutorials in Cost Analysis and Engineering Economy.



After 2 years of teaching, she went on to become an Associate Consultant at Stern Value Management for 3 years where she led and successfully implemented Value-Based Operational Analysis. It was followed by a brief stint as a Senior Consultant for a big data analytics firm in Singapore.



Prior to joining Oracle, Janet was part of lloopp's core team as Head of Data Science. Together with the founders, she had been instrumental in building the company, its culture, and its products around Deep Machine Learning from scratch.

headline: Data Scientist at Singapore Tourism Board
about:
Currently a Data Scientist and highly motivated to support provision of strategic data-driven insights to enable organisations make better decisions.



Strategic and client-focused professional with 17+ years of IT and project management experience.



Presently involved in analysing geo-location, survey and spend data to generate insights, building tools to help detect anomalies in data and developing dashboards to visualise data for business users.



Skilled in working with international organisations within the logistics, retail, hi-tech & automotive industries to enhance supply chain and logistics performance through strategic planning, process re-engineering, and information technology implementation. Rolled out tools, processes, and knowledge base needed to create customer value.



Known for ability to reformulate highly technical information into concise, understandable terms for internal and external stakeholders.



Lead in all facets of project lifecycle development, from feasibility study, requirements gathering, solution design through documentation, implementation and enhancements.



Completed a Masters of Technology degree in Enterprise Business Analytics from the National University of Singapore with a solid theoretical and hands on foundation on Advanced Data Analytics, Business Analytics, Predictive Analytics as well as Decision Making and Optimisation.



Completed a part-time Masters internship with iSentia – Brandtology working on sentiment mining and text article classification.



Detail oriented, solutions focused and customer-centric. Good communication and interpersonal skills facilitates work with individuals from all professional levels and diverse backgrounds. Fluent in English and conversant in Mandarin.



Analytics and Business Intelligence • Machine Learning • Process Reengineering • System Automation • Business Analysis • International and Regional Experience • Multi-industry Experience • Cross Functional Management • Project Management

headline: Data Scientist | Certified ScrumMaster - Digital Products & IoT Projects | Singapore PR
about:
Rohit is a Data Scientist with a “turn insights into actions” approach to driving practical results in businesses. His background includes application of Machine Learning and Advanced Analytics techniques for insights discovery, predictive analytics and solution design.



Key strengths include:

• Machine Learning based model creation for predictive products, strategic decisions making, business optimization and risk aversion

• Data warehousing, wrangling, preprocessing and ETL for analytics

• Collaboration with data procurement teams and service providers for end-to-end solutions

• Dealing with clients to solve business challenges and implement solutions

• Managing project teams with a genuine interest in developing people

• Working experience with Agile and Waterfall PM methodologies

• Personal differentiators: Capacity to see the “big picture”, Positive attitude, Agility and adaptability, Customer focus, Team and personal development

headline: Big Data Enthusiast
about: Shi Lei is currently Senior (but not old) Data Scientist in Singapore's leading AI startup -- AIDA Technologies. He has more than ten years of experiences doing research and development in big data processing and analysis in top-tier university and start-up companies. He has published research papers in top-tier computer science conferences and journals, and developed multiple platforms on big data analysis and computer vision using deep learning technologies. His research interests focus on large-scale data processing and analysis, parallel and distributed computing, stream processing, database theories and applications, artificial intelligence, and deep learning technologies.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Metis
about:
Data Scientist with 5-6 years of experience in building Machine Learning models to solve hard business problems using big data. In Singapore’s largest bank, I revamped and built their first Deep Learning based Recommender System for product advertisements on internet/mobile banking. Besides Data Science, I have a professional passion in joining the dots between multiple stakeholders especially product owners and data engineers.



I also have working experiences in Singapore, Shanghai, Sydney and San Francisco. When I am not teaching, I am exploring other interests in the domain of reinforcement learning and interesting applications of transfer learning.



Blog: https://nhanwei.github.io/

Github: https://github.com/nhanwei



Skills Summary:

Machine Learning and Modelling:

Linear Regression, Logistic Regression, Decision Tree, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, SVM, kNN, Neural Networks, Naive Bayes, Clustering, PCA, SVD, Recommender Systems, Deep Learning, OCR



Data and Analytics Tools/Languages:

Python(Keras, Numpy, Pandas, Scipy, Scikit-learn, Matplotlib), SQL(PostgreSQL), NoSQL(MongoDB, Neo4j), Spark(Pyspark, MLlib, GraphX, Spark Streaming), Pig, Hive, MapReduce, R (caret, H2O, shiny, ggplot2, plumber, future), SAS, Git, Tableau, VBA



What I do when I'm not doing data science:

Go for long walks/hikes, aquascaping, reading, gaming

about:

headline: Data Scientist at Hearti
about:
I have over 4 years of experience leading advanced analytics and data science projects, and have been involved in all project phases from problem assessment and requirements formulation, to model development, deployment and training. Throughout my career, I have led several regional and cross-functional analytics projects that improved efficiencies and generated multi-million dollars return on investment and cost savings to date.



I am currently a data scientist at Hearti, a fintech startup that specializes in developing enterprise platforms using Artificial Intelligence and Blockchain technologies for insurance and HR management. Prior to joining Hearti, I was in the decision science team at Seagate Technology where I pioneered the application of predictive (systems simulation) and prescriptive (mathematical optimization) analytics to support strategic, tactical and operational levels of planning in the organization.



A strong believer of continuous learning and passionate about the application of analytical models to drive decision making in complex business environments, I am working towards a part-time masters degree in Knowledge Engineering, specializing in Artificial Intelligence and Data Science at NUS. Am honored to be a recipient of the inaugural Singapore Digital (SG:D) Postgraduate Scholarship.



Reach out to me for anything AI and analytics related.

Would love to learn about volunteering opportunities in data science.



Core Interests & Competencies: deep learning, computer vision, operations research

headline: Head Data Scientist
about:
• Led a team of data scientists and analysts in the fleet management and predictive maintenance domain.

• Devised strategies for scaling data science to meet project requirements.

• Mined maintenance logs (both structured and unstructured) to uncover defect trends and patterns; and provide insights on the availability and health of platforms and systems.

• Developed data products that enhances the fleet management system to facilitate maintenance decisions.

• Exploited big data technologies to analyse massive telemetry data and develop anomaly detection models using machine learning (novelty detection/semi-supervised methods)

• Led data engineers and application team to operationalise anomaly detection models in systems to pre-empt defects and failures actively.

• Provided training to help build up data science competency for the organisation.

• Presented the use of machine learning for predictive maintenance of marine diesel engine at Public Service Engineering Conference 2018.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Bank of America
about:
Senior Staff Data Scientist | Big Data Analytics | Data Mining | Machine Learning

Applying cutting-edge quantitative methods to solve business problems and support data-driven decision making. Designing and developing AI platform to optimize client interactions



Business Interests: AI platform, big data analytics, predictive analysis, design of experiment, channel analytics, user behavior modeling, data visualization, data management



Research Interests:Statistical learning with high dimensional data, spatio-temporal modeling, text mining, machine learning, stochastic models, and feature selection.



Specialties: AI Platform Architecture, Big Data Analytics, Text Mining, Machine Learning, Data Visualization, Spatio-Temporal Modeling, GIS, Business Analysis, Software Development Life Cycle Management, Software Development (coding in R, Python,PyTorch,Julia, .Net, C++)



A firm believer in data-driven management who hypothesizes the cause of a problem, finds/collects data, analyzes and researches the hypothesis, and then implements the best solution.



Specialties:

Deep Learning for NLP, Deep Learning for Computer Vision, Deep Learning for Genomics and Biomedicine,

Hacking for Diplomacy, Information Retrieval, Computational Molecular Biology, Machine Learning





Conceptualize simulation framework and architecture to address identified problems



Deep dive into data to conduct advanced statistical analyses and modeling

Incorporate machine learning and optimization algorithms and simulate their impact on the overall system

Effectively conceptualize analyses to business/product stakeholders

Drive product improvements and confidence before the roll-out of new features

Good knowledge in stochastic modeling, assignment, queuing systems, forecasting, scheduling, simulation, optimization, Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning

• Managed and directed an offshore associate to deliver end-to-end reporting and analytical effort to drive and support for corporate strategic decisions addressing the Customer Experience business
• Exhibited leadership by training a team of 10 senior analysts on statistics, regression, and machine learning through giving lectures and assigning online courses'}, {'title': 'Optimum', 'company': 'OpenStack', 'duation_date': 'Dec 2016 – Mar 2017', 'duration_length': '4 mos', 'description': 'Data Scientist

UOB (Optimum Payroll) Singapore

December 2016 to Mar 2017


APPLE PAY MODEL:

Apple Pay is a software/hardware capability on Apple iPhones that enables credit card payments at point of purchase directly from the phone. This year Bank of America has committed to double BAC Apple Pay adoption from approx. 800,000to 1.6 million users. Because it is such a anew technology there is no literature or experience on how to drive usage increase. The Model development team’s conjecture is that the fastest path to increase usage is to target customer that are similar to the ones currently using Apple Phones.

Model Development Purpose and Intended Use:

This model has been developed to support marketing to increase Apple pay adoption and usage. This Model will guide who is targeted in adoption marketing campaigns for Apple Pay.

This Model is based upon classification and regression tree(CART) model that identifies customers that have a high propensity to use Apple Pay. The population being studies consist of those customers hwo has phone capability to use Apple Pay application. The depended variable is an indicator that the customer has actually used Apple Pay or not. The model identifies the customer that look likes those who are currently using Apple Pay. Customers so identifies will be priories for initial market campaign.




As part of an Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) team, working as a subject matter expert to deliver new Big Data and Machine Learning solutions for our business partners.

 Providing high-velocity analytics and business intelligence solutions that help enterprises globally Measure, Monitor and Manage their business levers effectively.
 Design analytical solutions/experiments to solve various strategic business problems through engagement and research.
 Build and deploy Machine Learning Algorithms, Advanced Analytics, and Data Visualization across the region.

headline: Data Scientist at Lynx Analytics
about:
My website: https://www.timlrx.com/



Econometrician, Data Scientist, Analytics Consultant. Proficient in R, Python, PySpark, Javascript, Stata, and SQL. Experience building and deploying models for consumer analytics (up-sell / cross-sell / churn), fraud detection and investment optimization use cases. Current interests includes blockchain analytics, labour economics, natural language processing (NLP), applied econometrics / statistics and graph theory.



I have 6 years of experience in applied data analysis across different industries and subject domains. In my current work with Lynx Analytics, I provide end to end data science consulting services. Clients I have worked with include Celcom, Telkomsel, Levi's, Swire and Cyber Security Agency (Singapore). In addition, I lead an internal work-stream on applying graph analytics to blockchains.



As an Economist at the Ministry of Trade and Industry (Singapore), I conducted policy evaluation studies using econometric methods and improved the measurement of national productivity estimates.



I love to help people make sense of their data and am open to collaborations or other interesting opportunities, especially if they are related to broader public policy issues. Contact me on LinkedIn or through the following email address: timothy.lin at alumni.ubc.ca

headline: Data Scientist at Twitter
about:
I'm a data scientist with a technical education (bachelor and master in Computer Engineering) and a business background.

I always approach data science problems from a business point of view, trying to keep everything simple and giving crucial importance to a clear communication.

I use the agile approach and the lean methodology to quickly deliver results and improve them iteratively.



Technologies/tools I'm more familiar with:

– Python

– Pandas

– Scikit-learn

– SQL

– PySpark

– HiveQL

– Excel



Specialties:

– applying data science to solve marketing-related problems

– classification and regression algorithms

– business acumen

– programming skills

– stakeholder management

– data products lifecycle management

– problem solving

headline: Data Science, Analytics at TrustSphere | Asia Analytics Alliance
about:
I’m a people’s person with a love for working with data. An avid reader of content surrounding Data, Science, Psychology, Strategy and Organizational Dynamics, I believe innovation and education are the keys to effective change. I'm hoping to contribute to the industry, in this ever-growing Digital age!



I have a keen interest in problem solving, interfacing with clients and integrating business requirements with technology. My experience covers using Hadoop, Python, R and tools such as Tableau, SAS on a range of use cases.



I currently lead the Data Science team at TrustSphere, concurrently working with the Strategy function. Within Data Science my role involves end to end ownership and hands on implementation in full life-cycle of advanced analytics projects. I'm also involved in DS collateral and innovation projects! Within Strategy, my work revolves around ideation and scoping with clients.



I graduated from the Singapore Management University with a degree in Master of IT in Business specializing in Analytics, in addition to a background of Engineering-IT.



Core strengths: Leadership, problem solving and integration of multiple channels of work.

headline: Data Scientist - Business Analytics at Infineon Technologies
about:
A Data Science Engineer with three years of experience, having an insatiable intellectual curiosity and business acumen capable of turning dry statistical analysis to an exciting story that influences the strategic direction of the business.



I recently graduated with a Masters in Knowledge Engineering from National University of Singapore and my courses in Big Data Engineering, Data Science and Analytics have given me solid base upon which I plan to build my career as a Data Scientist.



I have put my course theory into practice in a variety of ways, most effectively as a Data Scientist Intern where I developed an online profile Driven Algorithm in python and NoSQL Graph DB. This project has increased the value of information that Analytical Models could derive from data.



As part of our curriculum, I have done various project using R, Python, SPSS, and Hadoop framework for practicing various visualization, analytical and statistical techniques.



My previous work experience of three years as a C# .Net Programmer and Business Rules developer for TCS has provided me an opportunity to Productionize Data Models i.e. implement Predictive Models in a Business Rules Engine which is a Decision Rules Management System, frame SQL Queries to fetch data for quality assurance purposes, create web services and develop web applications.

headline: Data Scientist at NTUC Enterprise
about:
A client facing Data Scientist with demonstrated track records of selling and delivering end-to-end analytics solutions in IT Consulting and E-Commerce. A result-oriented problem solver with professional skills in Business Analytics and Machine Learning. A firm believer in the power of driving business and customer impact through thoughtful analysis and data-driven insights.



Skills and Qualifications:

- Sound knowledge in statistical methodology and machine learning algorithms.

- Strong programming skills in SQL, R, Python.

- Working experience with Cloud Solutions: Amazon Web Services (AWS EC2, S3, Redshift) and Google Cloud Platform (GCP Cloud Storage, Big Query).

- Working experience with Tableau, Shiny, and PowerBI.

- Certified developer in SAS (base code, EG, EM) and IBM (SPSS, Watson).

- Proven time management and project management skill.

- Strong communication skills in both oral and written and the ability to interact with senior management.

headline: Data Engineer at GovTech Singapore
about:
Versatile data professional focussed on delivering value on data from upstream (data infrastructure and pipelines) to downstream (analytics and machine learning).



In a past life not too long ago, I was a Foreign Service Officer with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs jetting around the world (ask me how I transitioned to tech!)



Some of my favourite tools:



- Data science: R (data.table,dplyr,tidyverse)/ Python (pandas,scikit,keras,numpy,matplotlib,tf)

- Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, mongoDB, Cassandra, DynamoDB, Redshift, RDS

- Back-end: Flask/node/Go

- Web servers: nginx/Apache

- Big Data: Spark, Hadoop, Beam

- DevOps: Docker/Kubernetes/Jenkins

- Workflow management: Jenkins/Airflow

- Logging: ELK stack

- Cloud: AWS/GCP

- Visualisation: ggplot2/Tableau/matplotlib

headline: Data Science | Big Data | AI | Deep Learning | Machine Learning | Analytics
about:
My Goal is to become an Intuitive Data Analytics professional who can generate monetizable Insights from the data. My interests include Data Mining, Data visualization,Text Mining, Pattern Recognition.



As an IBM Certified Database Developer at TCS I got fascinated towards data and then Joined Knowledge Engineering at NUS a course related to Artificial Intelligence and Data Mining.



My Key Skills include..



1. Data Mining/ Business Analytics

2. Text Mining

3. Data Cleaning using R,Excel and ETL

4. SQL

5. Pattern Recognition

6. Neural Networks

7. Visualizations

8. Exploratory Data Analysis

headline: Data Scientist at SGX
about:
I started out as a data analyst with a statistics background and am now engaged in the field of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence (AI) Technologies. I am also blessed with the opportunity and experience to develop production grade algorithms for anomaly detection models, assess credit risk of individuals, conduct multi-agent simulations to help agents learn and function within the hadoop & spark ecosystem.

Other areas and projects include: Natural Language Processing (NLP), Image Processing, Graph & Network Analysis, Time Series Analysis, R Shiny Application Development



I'm always interested to meet like-minded individuals so do ping me if you would like a casual conversation or if there are opportunities in related fields!

headline: Data Scientist @ HSBC
about:
Alex Shuguo HAN’s([ˈʃʊɡwə]) Expertise: Data Analytics, Machine Learning, AI, Big Data Architecture, Corporate Finance, and Project Management.



Ten year hands-on and six year project management experience to deliver data analytics projects as data scientist or project manager role for HSBC, BNY Mellon, Standard Chartered, MediaCorp, SingTel, PingAn Insurance, Softbank Mobile, etc. Won various international/national industry and academic awards, and a US patent. Acquired several Coursera certificates about Finance/Banking.



Graduated from Nanyang Technological University for B.Eng. in year 2006 and Ph.D. in year 2010. His research outcome appeared in tier-one Machine Learning/Data Mining conferences and journals, e.g., IEEE TKDE, ACM SIGKDD, IEEE ICDE, etc.

headline: In the "Data" tide
about:
The AKEOS project aims to extract key information from Google query result and show them to the user in a graph which is easy to understand. In such a way, users no longer need to go through every article, instead, they can quickly grasp the key information from the graph.



AKEOS system includes several modules:



- Text crawling: Extract only the text from webpages and save them to database

- Feature word selection: An Enhanced TF-IDF algorithm is proposed to select the useful feature words

- Relevant sentence selection: Using the feature word to select the most relevant sentences from the crawled corpus with the help of word embedding

- Entity extraction: Extract entities from a relevant sentence such as person, organization, date, quantitative words, etc

- Building knowledge graph



Above processes are all conducted in an unsupervised way which requires no human intervention, unstructured text is transformed into a structured graph.



With similar accumulated query results, AKEOS can also build Bayesian Network from them to perform causal inference. The Bayesian Network module consists:



- Candidate node selection

- Generating CPT: CPT for each candidate node is generated automatically from database

- Construction of Bayesian Network

headline: Data Scientist at Deloitte Singapore
about:
Text Mining techniques were used in order to help the clients know which are the jobs that will be automated, outsourced and worked remotely. (Tool used: Python)

Data Science algorithms like neural network, random forest were used to train the model and predict the disruption percentage of different job roles. (Tool used: Python)

Scenario based calculations was handled based on the requirements from the clients. (Tool used: Python)

Keywords based predictions was handled out in order to know which job profiles will be automated, outsourced and worked remotely. (Tool used: Python)

Data Visualization was carried out for the figures comes out as a prediction for all the disruptors. (Tool used: Tableau)

Network Analysis was done for the organization to know how well the people in the organization interact with each other and who the influencers are. (Tool used: Python)

Web Based Data Visualization was developed for the network analysis project to show the network graph of the organization and charts related to network analysis. (Tool used: Plotly using Python)

Financial Dashboard was developed for the executives to look in to inflow and outflow of financial data in the team (Tool used: Tableau)

headline: Data Scientist at Twitter
about:
At GIC, I was a member of the data science team which collaborated with investment teams to use data-driven techniques (NLP, Machine Learning and Spark) for trading signal research with the goal of generating alpha.



Project 1 (Based on http://hobergphillips.usc.edu/industryconcen.htm)



Using large-scale text mining of SEC filings and integrating momentum-based trading strategies, we built and evaluated a trading strategy. My contribution includes text mining pipeline implementation using Spark (Python, Java, Topic Modelling/LDA). Using topic modeling, we were able to identify latent relationships between companies (competitors/similar) using their product and business descriptions. This information is value added over the standard GICS classification of companies which is static and does not model the ever changing business world. I also performed deep dive analysis and prepared a case-study into the construction and behavior of text-mining & momentum-based trading signal.



Project 2:

POC to evaluate Bloomberg’s New Analytics and Event Driven Feed product for alpha generation.



Data feed included 2-years of story and company level sentiment analytics scores along with raw news feed which can be used for alpha research.



Signal Research related work:

Implemented the data cleaning and preparation pipeline for Bloomberg XML feed.

Implemented data exploration/analysis & sentiment-based interday strategy.

Implemented the backtesting framework on Spark and evaluated signal performance/returns over parameter space (region, holding period, sectors, etc.)



Sentiment Analysis Work:

Feature Extraction for Sentiment Analysis - The goal for this task was to extract features for sentiment classification of financial documents.

Expanded Loughran and McDonald Sentiment Wordlist using Wordnet

Identified most predictive features for financial documents (Positive/Negative Sentiment Features) using text classification techniques.

headline: Data Scientist | Machine Learning | Advanced Analytics | Data Viz
about:
To keep it simple, I am excited about Data!! I love to torture data and get the truth out of it. It's not just about data analysis, I am passionate about visualizing it too. I have a Master's in Analytics from Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (Ranks 11th in the world & 1st in Asia). Due to my interest in human behavior pattern and the reasons/science behind it, I did my Master's in Psychology. Adding to my academic achievements, I did my Master's in Business Administration specializing in Human Resource Management & Business Operations. I am a published author with respect to Management science & Analytics in HRM.



I worked with various high profile technology, consulting firms like Amazon, Accenture in Data Intelligence and Solutioning projects . I have worked with clients who are market leaders in sectors like Insurance, Logistics, Manufacturing. I am interested in Technology with respect to Data Science that includes Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

headline: Data scientist with strong business-oriented background, specialising in data analytics, machine learning, and AI
about:
Hi, thank you for viewing my profile and showing an interest in me. I am a data scientist with a strong background in business; professionally, I’ve had extensive experience working with real-world industry data sets across platforms and systems, and I specialise mostly in predictive modeling and quantitative analytics.



I thrive in complex and innovative environments – my passion lies in creating change, and in innovating to bring about improvements to the status quo. I’m most driven by the possibility of converting my ideas into tangible solutions, with visible impact on the daily lives of others. I greatly enjoy problem-solving, finding patterns and solutions to otherwise-impossible problems.



In addition to the above, my specialist skillset also consists of R&D, data science, application design, solution architecture, and IT consulting. My main technical domain experience is in machine learning, process automation, data mining, and analytics.



Please feel free to get in touch with me directly at vickneshmano1@gmail.com. I look forward to connecting with you!

headline: Data Scientist at UOB
about:
> **Loving data. Dare to speak for it.**



As a data scientist armed with both capability of quantitative reasoning and data engineering insights, I work smoothly with teams developing in a modern Big Data infrastructure, and deliver concrete data product to solve empirical problems in fields of information security and e-commerce.



### balanced in academics and empirics

+ hands-on experience with machine learning techniques and quantitative reasoning

+ good balance between theory on statistics and practical engineering for data analytics



### multi-languaged

+ extreme fluency in the R language

+ rich experiences in other statistical package including Stata, SAS, Matlab and Rats

+ working knowledge of general-purpose languages including Python and Scala

+ familiarity with Linux shell scripting

+ experiences in database query (and query-like) languages: SQL, Apache Pig



### data engineering insight

+ experiences of developing production-quality applications in both Spark and Hadoop ecosystem

+ experiences on bulding both Splunk and ELK-stack applications

+ familiarity with Docker

+ familiarity with Git



### attitude

+ highly self-trained: being an extremely quick and spontaneous learner

+ with a focus on data science career path: enthusiastic about new technologies

+ fluent, expressive, and flexible communication ability in both Chinese and English



### community activities

+ 2015

>> lecturer of agilearning.io web crawling course in R

>> lecturer of agilearning.io web crawling course in Python

>> lecturer of R language course in Data Science Conference 2015

>> speaker of R lightning talk in Data Science Conference 2015 (http://datasci.tw/)

+ 2014

>> lecturer of R language course Data Science Conference 2014 (http://twconf.data-sci.org/)

+ 2013

>> lecturer of Trend Micro internal R language course

headline: Data Scientist, Senior Manager at Lazada (Alibaba) Group
about:
*Collaborate with many teams, delivered highly impactful projects in Alibaba Globalization strategy.

*Optimize various metrics in e-commerce: gross merchandise volume(GMV), buyers click-through rate (CTR), sellers/retail store traffic, platform marketing ROI (voucher).



- 80% of the time: personalize shopping experience for millions of customers in 11 countries (Lazada and Daraz):

+ Build up data pipelines, models, A/B test, traffic allocation strategies for multiple real-time large scale personalization systems.

+ Customer profile and segmentation, add 24% more data points.

+ Automated personalized campaigns (Birthday, Double 9, Double 11, Double 12): Year Over Year CTR increased by 40%.

+ Smart pop-up voucher distribution.

+ Shake-shake personalized interactive game.

+ Daily flash sale personalization and optimization.



- 20% of the time

- Learn a wide range of Alibaba advanced technologies such as AliCloud, Warehouse Architecture, Machine Learning, etc.

- Mentor interns, junior data scientists/machine learning engineers in coding, testing, and modeling best practices.

- Build a strong platform mindset, build shareable, reusable data features for other team members, improve the productivity of the team.

headline: Data Scientist at Grab
about:
I spent the first 6 years of my career understanding human perception/cognition and designing/developing complex system (e.g. decision support) for defense applications.



And spent another few years working on improving government services and citizen lives with data science products.



Now I am working with data scientists to improve the dev-to-deploy turnaround time and stability for any new model/data science services we are introducing.



tldr. I spent most of my career solving all sort of problems: I am a full stack engineer with experience in UX/UI, data visualization, front-end, backend, databases, machine-learning, data engineering, as well as devops.



I also contributes to or start open-source projects that interest me (or need) such as webcomponents and kubernetes-related projects.



My passion is about finding simple solutions to interesting problems - simplicity is not about how little there are, but how natural they feel.
experiences:
[{'title': 'Lead Data Scientist', 'company': 'Grab', 'duation_date': 'Oct 2018 – Present', 'duration_length': '1 yr', 'description': 'The data science infrastructure and workflow guy for Grab transport:

- encourage good software engineering practices to the data science team through team/individual sharing and providing the tools to encourage good coding behaviors (e.g. project templates with linting, unit tests, CI/CD setup, implementing code reviews, ...)

- kick-started migration of existing cloud infrastructure management into terraform, as well as improve overall design of cloud resources/policies.

- kick-started initiative to use kubeflow pipelines within transport data science, including contributing back to open-source kubeflow as individual contributor.

- deprecate old k8s clusters and migrate to new k8s clusters (dev, stg, prd-a/prd-b) with better deployment workflow and maintainability together with engineers from different tech families.

- slowly improving end-to-end data science workflow: feature engineering -> model building -> deploying micro-service -> monitoring/stability

- manage and ensure stability of data science infrastructure and services as well as coordinating with other teams to ensure availability of services (both upstream and downstream).


See less'}, {'title': 'Senior Engineer', 'company': 'GovTech Singapore', 'duation_date': 'May 2014 – Oct 2018', 'duration_length': '4 yrs 6 mos', 'description': 'Data scientist for simple machine learning or data analysis project. Technical lead for projects that need to deliver a data product (i.e. app, platform, or service).

Project highlights:

- Reroute started off as an one-off analysis on and after which a team was formed to build a data analytic product which can empower bus planners to simulate and test hypothesis for their improvement to the public transport network.

- Govtext is a topic modelling as a service which can be easily deployed both on cloud or on-premise servers. The primary use case is to allow public servants to quickly identify key or emerging topics from their textual data (e.g. citizen feedbacks).

- Labor market explorer was a proof-of-concept where skills (and other metadata) are extracted from job descriptions (jobsbank) and resumes (indeed) and used to demonstrate the mismatch between salary, industry, number of applications, number of vacancy, as well as the skills between different demographics. See less'}, {'title': 'Senior Member of Technical Staff', 'company': 'DSO National Laboratories', 'duation_date': 'Apr 2008 – May 2014', 'duration_length': '6 yrs 2 mos', 'description': 'Worked as a researcher in Information visualization group under the Human Factors Engineering (HFE) programme.

As a human factors engineer for information design and visualization, I solve design problems by
(i) applying the engineering design process,
(ii) leveraging on visual-cognitive and behavioral sciences, and
(iii) working with domain experts.

Most of the projects involved are classified but the problem-space includes how to generate insights, reduce information overflow, and effective use of limited cognitive resources for big data problems.

The work required involved both design and development of software prototypes/POC, and working with experts from various domains and expertises. The primary project I was involved in was the design, simulation, prototyping, and testing of microfluidic devices for water quality monitoring.

As a micro-fluidic engineer, I was involved in the

(i) design (AutoCAD) and simulation (Fluent) of the micro-fluidic channels/filters,

(ii) prototyping using various technology, such as laser machining, heat-curing of PDMS, silicon lithography (I just design the mask, the actual process was done by another staff), and

(iii) fluidic (pressure head and flow measurements) and bio-chemical testing (bio-tagging of e.coli) of the devices. See less'}]

headline: Building the Singapore Urban Solutions R&D Ecosystem
about:
I was born in Singapore in 1985. Schooled in design and informatics, I work at the intersection of Data Science and Spatial Planning to tackle challenges faced by cities. I specialise in the development and application of data analytics, modelling and simulation for insights into big urban data. Apart from quantitative research methodologies, I have also obtained formal education in traditional approaches to urban analysis. During my doctoral research, I had the unique opportunity to collaborate with European policy makers as well as spatial and transportation planners at regional (NUTS-2) and local (NUTS-3) scales.



关键字: 数据可视化, 地理可视化, 可视化分析, 探索数据分析, 城市研究, 城市规划, 基于代理设计



Follow me on Twitter: @purestform (https://twitter.com/purestform)

View my demos on Vimeo: https://vimeo.com/alvincyh

educations:
[{'school': 'University of Leuven', 'type': 'Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.)', 'course': 'Engineering Science', 'duration': '2012 – 2016', 'description': 'The Role of Data Visualisation in Urban Studies

As large volumes of data become increasingly available, new opportunities arise to harness their potential for urban studies. Data visualization is vital for this purpose, particularly in tackling fuzzy problems that require an explorative process of discovery to re-frame. This research investigates how data visualization can be used to harness big data for domain specific challenges in urban studies. To address this question, I demonstrate the utility of data visualization in four different case studies and developed a framework to compare their outcomes from design to application. Based on this comparison, I show how data visualization facilitates discovery, contemplation and presentation amongst other roles. Reflecting on my experience from this research, I discuss the factors to consider when developing data visualizations for particular roles in urban studies, and share my thoughts on the need for novel visualization techniques.'}, {'school': 'LASALLE College of the Arts', 'type': 'Master’s Degree', 'course': 'Design', 'duration': '2007 – 2010', 'description': 'Adaptive Formats

The making of form involves a linear process where individual actions are thought and composed. From paintings to digital imaging, this act is dictated in a linear sequence. Digital software today aids this process but much remains unchanged in the way form is assembled. This process is inherently limited to one’s intention and the capability of software functionalities. Form-finding, on the contrary, involves an emergent process. No explicit decisions are considered or made resulting in derived rather than imposed outcomes. In this thesis, I describe a series of experimental software developed to escape from such limitations. These programmes are simulations of processes intended to find and refine form. Applying simple rules, an emergent aesthetic is derived from the interactions which surpass intentionality and the conventions of commercial software functionalities. With such software, the designer can find forms derived from a process of change.'}, {'school': 'Temasek Polytechnic', 'type': 'Diploma', 'course': 'Interactive Media Design, Electronic Media Design', 'duration': '2003 – 2005', 'description': 'Nil'}]

headline: Lead Data Scientist at BCG GAMMA
about:
I have a strong background in data analytics and software development as evidenced by my BSc in Electrical Engineering (Information option), MSc in Pattern Recognition, various online courses in Analytics (both Coursera and MIT) as well as the Phd I am currently completing in the analysis of social media conversation networks.



My experience has further extended on this as I have worked with data throughout my career primarily in the Banking Industry. I have worked across and am comfortable with multiple roles in an analytics engagement from overall project responsibility to designing and implementing the solutions. I have assisted my customers with a wide variety of problems through in depth understanding of their businesses and interrogation of their data assets.



I have also had extensive management experience from managing multiple teams to defining the strategy and vision for specific divisions.

Also work on creating systems and engines to parse and aggregate data from banks, building APIs. Work with Python, Pandas, Numpy. Tensorflow and Django or Flask mostly.

Canopy (https://canopy.cloud) is a Singapore based fintech that offers a next generation account aggregation, portfolio analytics and client reporting platform for high net-worth individuals and wealth professionals. See less'}, {'title': 'Data Science Lead | Co-Founder', 'company': 'Chatoyance', 'duation_date': 'May 2014 – Nov 2018', 'duration_length': '4 yrs 7 mos', 'description': 'Chatoyance.org
Deep fintech providing A.I. and machine learning tools to augment/replace over a fund or for everyday investors to independently match up in competency against entire funds or prop firms. Leveling the playing field.

Analytics AI
1. Provide sentiment analysis using NLP against hundreds of finance-related news sources across Bloomberg, Twitter, and more to provide overall market sentiment by the second. Bullish or bearish?
2. Trend prediction and price direction. Uses A.I. and deep learning to go through dozens of sources from price to news, volumes, order flow, fundamental and technical analysis, etc. and output two values - what the trend is in a specific timeframe and the predicted price direction in X amount of time.
3. Market randomness; goes through market history and highlights areas or alerts moments when the market is no longer in a random walk.

Risk Management AI
1. Analytics to determine the optimum risk for a strategy.
2. Augments risk on a per-trade basis based on prediction of outcome and volatility. Minimize losses and maximize gains. Transforms poor and average strategies into excellent strategies by augmenting risk adaptively with machine learning.

Trade and Strategy Generation AI
1. Using the latest reinforcement learning developments to piece together analytics and risk management to generate an optimal trading strategy. Verified against several years of walk forward analysis using out-of-sample data. Customization to preferences, risk appetite, frequency, and volume.
2. Either replaces a trader or outputs trade recommendations.

Chatoyance Trading Group Platform
Service enabling users to form dynamic trading groups. Trade sharing in a P2P manner. Enter and leave whenever. Allows traders to create their own prop groups on the fly and trade as a team rather than having to pool money into a single account. headline: Senior Data Scientist at Siemens
about:
Some of the keywords you can associate with me:

Machine Learning

Data Analytics

Programming



Ability to grasp fundamentals and leveraging them in solving real life problems is one of my core assets.

Naturally good at mathematics. Numbers and the art of inference fascinate me.

Specialties: Analytical problem solving, analysis of big data, Python scripting and software development using various languages, statistics, Data Visualization and communication.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at CtrlShift
about:
Lead a reconciliation project using Python in an international bank which helps the bank successfully accomplish the greatest data migration project worth US$600M in the history of financial industry and saves the bank from tremendous investment loss.



Participate in LTA DTL3 impact analysis on commuters and bus routes using R. This project analyzes the traveling patterns of the commuters before and after DTL3 by the shortest path algorithm. The impacts on the bus routes are then generated based on these patterns. The results are displayed through Tableau dashboards which help LTA pinpoint the critical paths or bus routes in order to optimize their bus routes to boost the utilizations.

This project uses machine learning technique to build a recommendation engine which offers each customer different kinds of data, sms, voice packages based on more than 200 personal variables. This model automatically generates thousands of leads every day, and the leads are contacted via various sales channels such as telesales phone calls, Facebook pages and line app. The results outperform the conventional human experience based campaigns.

Participate in smart city project from Info-communications Development Authority of Singapore (IDA). This project firstly crawls all the landed unit coordinates using Java and Jsp. Then this project analyses where the Singaporeans work and live based on time and distance approaches. This project also identifies where Singaporeans are every 15 minutes, and what routes they take for going to work and coming home using Hadoop, Hive and R.

Develop an automatic Amazon big data query engine using JavaServer Faces. This engine consists of three parts. The first part allows users who do not have any SQL background to generate sophisticated Hive query simply by clicking the categories and entering search keywords. After that, the second part automatically fires up self-adjusted Amazon clusters and loads the data into Hadoop to process this query. Finally, the third part moves the query results to Amazon S3 storage and shut down the cluster afterwards.

Develop and implement reverse geocoding tool using Java and Jsp. headline: Driving Data Science at Experian APAC
about:
Gaurav currently leads Experian's APAC DataScience team of ML practitioners and AI researchers with a focus on enterprise problem solving through data science in Financial Services Telco and Internet domains.



Passionate about building and leading high caliber teams to build next gen products. Strong focus on fraud detection, data monetisation, open-banking and credit-risk.



Gaurav holds an integrated master’s degree in Mathematics and Computing from Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi.



His work revolves around advanced analytics with a wide exposure in creating intelligent products/solutions. Since joining Experian, Gaurav has led the build of various award winning data and analytics products.



Earlier, he served as a principal at one of the largest internet companies in India to develop a personalized, real-time recommendation engine on unstructured data using Big Data, NLP and deep-learning. He has worked across multiple geographies in cross-cultural teams and handled a diverse set of Fortune 500 clients in his previous roles.



Speaker at Conferences - Property Guru Data Summit SG 2017, TM Forum SG 2017, Big Data world SG 2017, Singapore Fintech Festival SG 2018, Future of Information Conference, US 2018, Big Data and AI Leaders Summit SG 2019, Experian & IDC Roundtable Conference SG, 2019



Reach out to me at - gaurav.kumar.sah@gmail.com

about:
(Stay hungry. Stay foolish -- Steve Jobs)



During my PhD study, I’ve gained experience in R programming, data manipulation, data visualization, text mining and statistical modelling from multiple research projects using huge amount of human genetics data. As a self-motivated learner, I keep on learning new techniques from online courses and part-time master courses. Currently, I'm working on projects using operation research techniques, machine learning, and data preprocessing pipeline using Apache Spark.

headline: Data Scientist Team Lead, DBS
about:
Love Data, Love Programming.



Full stack data scientist: programming, data management, mining, analytics, visualization, and predictive modelling.



Computer Science PhD, 2009, National University of Singapore (NUS). Certificate from Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT), under the Singapore-MIT Alliance computer science programme.



Ten years' hands-on experience of managing and analyzing big data, including transportation data, telco data, and financial transaction data. Work with government agencies (e.g., URA, LTA) and commercial companies (e.g., SingTel, DBS, Visa). Integrate big data from multiple sources to derive actionable insights and develop innovative data system prototypes.



Five years' experience of leading research team and data project team. Design solution, communicate, and work with team to deliver.



Published more than 20 research papers on top international research conferences and journals such as IEEE MDM, EDBT, SSDBM, IEEE ICDE, VLDB, ACM SIGKDD, and ACM TODS.

headline: Data Scientist at DataRobot
about:
Clifton is a Customer-Facing Data Scientist for APAC at DataRobot, which provides automated machine learning for predictive modeling, anomaly detection, and time series analysis. His vertical domain expertise is mostly in banking, insurance, government; and his horizontal domain expertise is in cyber security, fraud detection, and public safety.



In his free time, Clifton volunteers professional services to events, conferences, and journals. Was also part of teams which won some analytics competitions.



Clifton’s PhD and bachelor's degrees are from Clayton School of Information Technology, Monash University, Australia.

headline: Artificial Intelligence & Data Science
about:
Le is Data Scientist with Microsoft Cloud and Artificial Intelligence. He has extensive experience on applying the cutting-edge machine learning and artificial intelligence technology to accelerate digital transformation for enterprises and start-ups. He has helped numerous corporations to develop and build enterprise-grade scalable advanced data analytical system, for scenarios of smart manufacturing, predictive maintenance, financial services, e-commerce, human resource analytics, etc. He specialises in cloud computing, big data technologies, and machine learning. He is proficient in R and Python.



Le is a frequent speaker at industrial and academic conferences and community meetups. He enjoys sharing knowledge and learning from people.

headline: Data Scientist at Synthesis
about:
Synthesis is a data-fuelled brand consultancy



We do Human Centred Data Science. The rigorous exploration of data underpinned by a strategic understanding of people, category and context



We use human understanding to ask better questions of the numbers. Our proprietary frameworks and algorithms are designed and tested by category experts to ensure we deliver fresh, smart and actionable output



Our team has experience across sectors, from beauty, to travel, FMCG and new media. We work globally and our tools work with all major languages, but we have special focus on Asia



We work on:

- Brand Equity & Positioning

- M&A and Portfolio Strategy

- Market & Target Understanding

- Advocacy & Influencer Strategy

- Early Trend Identification

- Service Experience Evolution

- Communications Strategy

headline: Data Scientist, Machine Learning Expert at IBM Research lab Singapore
about:
I am a Data Scientist with 10 years of software development and machine learning experience with real time applications in Smart cities, IoT, cloud computing, enterprise marketing and healthcare.

My research has been published in top tier machine learning and data mining conferences such as KDD and ICDM and resulted in 1 US patent.

I have expertise in developing supervised and semi-supervised deep learning models, location based services, spatiotemporal modelling and time series forecasting with multi-dimensional data from different sensors and live streams.

I write production ready code in Java, Python, R. I work with deep learning frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras and cloud platforms such as IBM Watson Studio and IBM Watson Machine Learning. I also work with Big Data technologies such as Spark, Hadoop, Kafka and Redis.

I supplement stakeholder discussions with business recommendations through data insights. I have strong leadership skills and enjoy working in a multi-disciplinary team. I am self-motivated and a life-long learner.

headline: Head of Artificial Intelligence at Vulcan-AI
about:
Accomplished data science and AI leader with over 12 years of experience in innovating and bringing new AI / data science driven solutions to different industries in both public and private sector.



As head of AI in Vulcan-AI I am leading a team of highly talented AI professionals focused on developing innovative products and solutions that leverage the latest in AI, IoT and emerging data sources such as remote sensing to create breakthrough capabilities in industries such as manufacturing, agriculture and trading etc. Our focus is to build these capabilities at scale to bring an enterprise AI solution for our clients



I have led development and deployment of innovative combinations of emerging capabilities such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, computer vision and optimization in areas such as UAV / drones images for precision agriculture, large scale Prognostics and Health Management models that monitor key assets across the plant leveraging thousands of sensors (IoT), machine learning and data science driven production prediction and optimization, real time AI based routing of citizen feedback at national level, smart grid analytics, population risk profiling leveraging electronic health record data etc.



I have 15 granted / pending patents and 10+ journal publications related to application of AI in areas such as healthcare, prognostics and health management of assets, smart grid, precision agriculture etc

about:

headline: Advanced Analytics Expert - Senior Data Scientist at The Boston Consulting Group (BCG)
about:
Prateek Singhal is a business focused and result oriented data science professional with 7 years of experience within the strategy consulting and high-tech product firms. He has expertise in solving complex problems for banking, retail, government, and telecom organization using advanced analytics.



Prateek is currently working as an Advanced Analytics Expert at The Boston Consulting Group, Singapore. Prateek is part of BCG Gamma and he focuses on Advanced Analytics, Machine learning & Artificial Intelligence (AI) consulting cases, proposals and client enablement engagements.



He has graduated with a Masters in Business Analytics from National University of Singapore (NUS). He holds a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Engineering and a master’s degree in Cyber Laws and Cyber Security from National Law University - India.

headline: I'm just a guy who's a data scientist for fun
about: A new challenger to the current meta of hyperspecialism (looking at you, computer vision specialist; you heard right, deep learning NLP researcher) with a well balanced build distributing technical skill points across a whole slew of data science techniques and industry domains stacked on top of a core skill base comprising of Gordian knot cutting, overlordship, nontechietongue and salesspeak.

headline: Data Scientist at Givaudan
about:
My friends would define me as hardworking and goal-oriented. My journey in Givaudan has been nearly 5 years (Supply chain analytics & Regional Process Champion for Self Service Business Intelligence in APAC) and I recently shifted from business to IM&T, Singapore.



Prior, I was working with Synthite (Market leader in Oleoresins) as the Lead Planner for Chilly portfolio handling FG,RM, Demand, Supply, Tolling, Inventory and Production Planning.



I recently started loving travelling, gym and making friends with complete strangers !
experiences:
[{'title': 'Data Scientist', 'company': 'Givaudan', 'duation_date': 'Oct 2016 – Present', 'duration_length': '3 yrs', 'description': 'Align to, Understand, and Prioritize Analytic Goals to Address Business Opportunities and Value

* Maintain an intimate understanding of company and department strategy
* Understand the business objectives in order to develop or establish success criteria metrics
* Translate business problems into one or more data science projects/solutions

Lead Efforts to Identify Signals in Data that Address Use Cases

* Understand business processes (data sources and meaning)
* Manage and optimize data discovery and cleansing
* Understand and collect relevant data
* Identify new data sources in the network that will create new insights to business needs
* Explore relevant data through visualization and statistical methods

Collect, Organize, and Prepare Data for Analysis

* Work with various volumes of data from multiple disparate sources and perform data analysis and mining to generate solutions to business problems
* Ensure processes taken to maintain data integrity
* Understand available data and what data is relevant
* Collaborate with data architects (IS engineers, BI engineers, DBAs, etc.) to ensure that data needed is available

Uncover Patterns in Data, Develop Models, and Evaluate Validity of Solutions

* Develop expertise in data mining and analytic methods
* Determine statistical validity and significance (pick out signals from noise)
* Identify and apply appropriate analytical models
* Evaluate results using statistical methods and improve the model where appropriate
* Develop predictive models

Deploy Data Science Models into Business Processes

* Present findings and deliver recommendations using effective presentation and data visualization techniques
* Ensure that the models are easy to support and maintain
* Regularly review deployed models and monitor for continual improvement
* Validate that the business value has been met'}, {'title': 'Global Supply Chain Analyst | Regional Process Champion - SSBI', 'company': 'Givaudan', 'duation_date': 'Aug 2014 – Jan 2018', 'duration_length': '3 yrs 6 mos', 'description': 'Support Givaudan’s global / regional SCM project teams in decision making and execution of key projects by providing meaningful insights/informations by sophisticated IT / Mathematical Technics and Solutions.

Provides support for raw material & production planning and inventory evaluation / risk assessment.

Support improvements in general processes, tools and capabilities of supply chain teams that result in improved customer service, efficiency and lower cost.

Essential Responsibilities

•Support Global / Regional projects with data collection, extraction, enrichment and analysis. Develop decision models supported with data / hypothesis
•Proactively address and resolve ad-hoc supply chain and planning issues. Assist with development of tools, reports and KPIs. Support training users on new capabilities / tools
•Provide back-up for the Regional / Site Planning – raw material and production'}, {'title': 'Operations Analyst', 'company': 'Synthite', 'duation_date': 'Jun 2013 – Jul 2014', 'duration_length': '1 yr 2 mos', 'description': 'I currently lead the Planning Operations for Chilly products (Oleoresins, spices, extract etc).I have been contributing to development and implementation of a new Planning Scenario through Cross-functional collaboration across multiple department groups and executive levels.

Key Responsibility areas include

 Innovation & Operational Excellence: As a key member and driver of the Planning operational excellence theme, I contributed substantially to streamline and optimize the inventory along with reduced lead time.

* Re-designed and optimized the material consumption plan to allocate material categorically thereby saving ~$1M per quarter in E&O cost.

*Engaged with traders to establish a warehouse to stock lead time critical Oleoresins thereby enabling trades to place larger orders. The initiative helped reduce lead times by half and enhanced CSAT significantly.

*Responsible for maintaining reorder quantity and economic order quantities of ingredients based on sales forecast

 Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborating with IT , Sales & Operations ,Logistics,Raw Materials, Quality,Finance, Production,Operational procurement, Marketing

 Reporting & Analytics: Providing Analytics/Dashboards and strategic consulting to the leadership/middle management on process order cost variance, Inventory stock analysis, delivery efficiency reports, market trends, Monthly BI report etc

 Forecasting: Based on Market research and forecasting techniques, optimizing the delivery efficiency

 Proactive Delivery: Ensuring the material moves on time as per the schedule by coordinating with the plant Managers, Sales Operations and Packing and forwarding team

 Team Management:Acting as a central pillar in tracking the performance of each unit planners in terms of their KPI and reporting the same to the Planning Head. It requires providing mentorship and training in their required supporting areas See less'}, {'title': 'Intern Trainee', 'company': 'Jet Airways', 'duation_date': 'Dec 2012 – Mar 2013', 'duration_length': '4 mos', 'description': 'Internship work done for Jet Airways, Bangalore on “Indian Business Women’s Buying Behavior towards Airlines with Special Reference to Jet Airways”.The project enabled me to conduct an extensive research on the air-ticket-buying pattern of Indian Business Women with respect to various factors like offers, ease of booking, comfort and convenience etc. The project consisted of studying the psychology of Business women globally to make a strategy proposal thereof. Based on analysis of data from depth interviews and questionnaires, a set of recommendations were proposed to Jet Airways on whether or not to promote ‘Jet Viva’-The Luxury program for Indian Business Women. See less'}]

headline: Senior Data Scientist at HP| ML| Deep Learning| NUS Masters- Data Science
about:
Highly motivated Data Scientist having over 4.5 years of experience and Masters(M.Tech) in Data Science from the National University of Singapore.



A Problem solver with a positive attitude and demonstrative leadership skills. I quickly master new software’s and possess a deep understanding and passion for data analytics.



I am currently working on Machine learning-based class algorithm for Quality improvement and virtual testing. AVI based Deep Learning (image classification- CNN), General anomaly detection and solving complex non-linear machine learning problems on highly biased data.



At HP, I have produced 9 IP’s which is protected awarded as a ‘trade secret’ by HP Inc. One of them is selected and is being filed with the USA IP office.



• Published multiple papers in external journals like IEEE, IJoART, etc. also published multiple papers in HP Internal (DSKD)Data Science and Knowledge discovery International conference.



•Leading, managing & running projects and programs for long term goals of the management.



• Presenting and communicating success stories to various management & technical team members of HP and other industries.



Hiring, managing and guiding Interns, junior teammates. Conducting analytics training courses.

Frequently get Invited and attend International Data Science conferences.



Best Young Scientist National Award 2018 - Selection over 500,000 profiles of age below 35 (based on application, research, and publication in Data Science field)



At Cognizant, was a part of Data Warehousing-Business Intelligence and analytics (trend analysis).

Awarded by the delivery director for critical work and support.



Worked in RMC as Data science intern for the forecast of South-West monsoon with Dr. R.Asokan (Scientists –E) Director RMC India, Published-IEEE paper - “Prediction of onset of southwest monsoon using Multiple Regression” -won the BEST paper award.



Have received Best Outgoing Student (Star of Excellence 2014) of Sathyabama University.

headline: Health analytics data scientist, Aon, Singapore
about:
A data scientist experienced in development and use of machine learning algorithms for solving problems related to computer vision in surveillance and medical domain.



My work revolves around data extraction, cleaning, processing using signal processing/characterization techniques, visualization and analysis. I have handled multi-modal spatio-temporal data using machine learning techniques and tools. I also possess research experience in developing machine learning algorithms for forecasting and prediction.



To deal with large scale streaming data, I have exploited various parallel, distributed computing techniques such as MapReduce framework and cloud infrastructure.
experiences:
[{'title': 'Health analytics data scientist', 'company': 'Aon Centre for Innovation and Analytics (ACIA)', 'duation_date': 'Aug 2015 – Present', 'duration_length': '4 yrs 2 mos', 'description': 'Nil'}, {'title': 'Postdoctoral Research Fellow', 'company': 'Nanyang Technological University, Singapore', 'duation_date': 'Jan 2015 – Aug 2015', 'duration_length': '8 mos', 'description': 'My primary responsibility is to develop effective information sharing and scheduling platform for multi-agent system. The developed platform would be used for multi-UAV task allocation.

I am also collaborating with other researchers in developing EEG based action recognition system for bionic devices. In this project, we are developing system for automatic extraction, cleaning and processing of data for different actions. We further analyse this spatio-temporal data for patterns to be learnt by machine learning techniques. Various visualization tools are used to understand the data and extract most relevant features.

It is also my responsibility to guide other bachelors, masters and PhD students in their work. I am currently working with an undergraduate to extract raw EEG signal and cleaning it. I am also collaborating with graduate students in analysing the EEG data and extracting relevant information from it. See less'}, {'title': 'Research Associate', 'company': 'Nanyang Technological University', 'duation_date': 'Apr 2014 – Dec 2014', 'duration_length': '9 mos', 'description': 'As a research associate, my responsibilities include improving the existing machine learning techniques for video/ energy/ medical analytics. In addition, I am also responsible for mentoring other graduate and post-graduate students in conducting their research.

Currently, I am involved in extending cognitive computing techniques for autonomous self-regulation of hardware robots.'}, {'title': 'PhD Candidate', 'company': 'Nanyang Technological University', 'duation_date': 'Aug 2010 – Apr 2014', 'duration_length': '3 yrs 9 mos', 'description': 'Supervisor: Dr. Suresh Sundaram

My PhD was on improving the abilities of machines in terms of learning, generalization. I developed a meta-cognitive mechanism for fuzzy neural networks (McFIS) with which they could self-regulate their learning.

The proposed system not only improved the learning and generalization of the networks but also improved its convergence ability as a result of which fewer resources are required to learn a better network. This system could process on-line streaming data in a life-long learning fashion.

I have used the developed McFIS for video analytics of 3D action recognition and emotion recognition. In action recognition, I have collaborated with Video Analytics Lab, IISC, India. The video was recorded in-house and was further preprocessed by cleaning, object of interest/feature extraction. McFIS was employed to map the different actions to the respective features.

For emotion recognition, the images were cleaned, calibrated, and preprocessed prior to being learnt using McFIS. Different analysis were performed to understand the effect of various features on emotion recognition ability of machines.'}, {'title': 'Research Internship', 'company': 'INRIA', 'duation_date': 'Mar 2013 – Aug 2013', 'duration_length': '6 mos', 'description': 'Advisor: Dr. Francois Bremond

My internship at STARS team, INRIA focused on developing a robust and online object tracker controller. A meta-cognitive neuro-fuzzy inference system based system identifier was employed to learn the functional relationship between various scene contextual information and tracker parameters. Based on the learnt relationship, the learning system could accurately select the ideal tracker parameters. See less'}]

headline: Data Scientist • Machine Learning
about:
• Data science

(a) Bayesian approach to understand individual wellbeing by implementing a smart health advisor web application that was tried by almost 600 people.

(b) Text analytics/mining (e.g. topic models) and sentiment analysis (e.g. Facebook and Twitter).

(c) Geospatial analysis of events and relating them for business analytics assessments via overlap clustering.

(d) Human resource analytics (e.g. attrition/turnover analysis and prediction, and employee engagement data mining).

(e) Recommender systems and machine learning for anomaly detection, dimension reduction, etc.

• Assisted to set up and grow iDA's first data science group.

• Conducted (business) analytics workshops for organizations and provided consultancy to stakeholders/users (e.g. master-plans/roadmaps).

• Facilitated data science Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs).

headline: Data Scientist
about:
Dermot is one of the account directors who really gets how to organise and run a successful "Big Data Analytics" / "Data Science" project. 

He knows who to bring in to form a team and when to each skill set into the project and is able to help summarise and articulate the issues and brings valuable industry experience to the table.

But what I like working with Dermot the most is his personality, cheerful and humourous but never losing sight of the goal of a project.

It is a pleasure working in a team with him.

headline: Helping Companies with Data | Data Science Consulting | Data Scientist | Speaker | Top Writer @Medium
about:
WHAT I DO:

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

I help start-up founders and various companies tackle their problems using data with strong expertise in data science consulting and industry knowledge.



HOW I DO IT:

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

I provide you the unbiased independent expert advice and the right analytics/data science solutions to uncover hidden insights and grow your company ... because DATA IS THE NEW CURRENCY.



SERVICES I PROVIDE:

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

✔️ Data Science Consulting

✔️ Data Analytics & Visualization (Storytelling)

✔️ Speaking (Workshop, Meetup, Conference)



WHERE YOU'VE SEEN ME:

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

💡 AI Time Journal

💡 Tech in Asia

💡 Medium

💡 Meetups / Conferences

💡 LinkedIn



LITTLE BIT ABOUT ME:

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

My passion is data — and I was fortunate to have had the opportunity to join CERN in Compact Muon Solenoid (CMS) experiment where I analyzed and simulated petabytes of data via Worldwide LHC Computing Grid — the place where I found my marriage with Big Data & Data Science!



I started out in academia (Physics) then transitioning into the Data Science world.



Since then I have been leveraging data to help companies answer their burning questions and provide solutions to their problems. My experience in various industries includes Transportation & Mobility Intelligence, E-Commerce, Gaming & Entertainment, and Semiconductor.



Being a Data Science Communicator at heart, I write and share my learning experience and knowledge on various publications.



WHAT ELSE?

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

▶️ Writer of Towards Data Science:

https://medium.com/@admond1994



▶️ To know more about me:

https://twitter.com/admond1994

http://admond1994.strikingly.com



▶️ Interested in knowing my previous and current projects?

https://github.com/admond1994



WHAT'S NEXT?

‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾‾

☑ Curious to know how I can help your company?

Let's talk and book a FREE call appointment with me: http://bit.ly/request-a-call-with-admond

headline: Principal Data Scientist at DSTA
about:
Principal Data Scientist (Experimentation & Prototyping)

- I am leading data integration and analytics experiments to derive insights for improving operations as proof-of-concept to scale up digital transformation in relevant business areas.



Stanford University: Sep 2016 - Mar 2018

- M.S. in Management Science & Engineering (3.99/4.0)

- Developed expertise in data analytics, machine learning, statistics, stochastic simulations through coding assignments in R, Matlab and Python.



Principal Analyst (Operations Research): Jul 2014 - Aug 2016

I planned and led studies to generate insights on opportunities and potential solution concepts; win buy-in from multiple stakeholders to put up coherent recommendations for clients to drive capability development through acquisitions or indigenous R&D. I have over 7 years of experience in Operations Research, which entails:

- Problem framing.

- Eliciting relevant inputs from diverse stakeholders.

- Deciding on study approach; Developing models/simulations; Generating insights.

- Developing, iterating and refining concepts with stakeholders into practical, holistic solutions.

- Communicating insights and recommendations through presentations and reports.

- Managing quality and schedule of study milestones and deliverables.



Feature Articles:

- https://www.dsta.gov.sg/docs/news-events/140621_st.pdf

- https://www.dsta.gov.sg/programmes/dsta-masterplanning-and-systems-architecting/plugging-into-a-networked-fighting-force



Publication:

- Z. Lian, S.H. Teo, Framework for Managing System-of-Systems Ilities, Complex Systems Design & Management Asia (2016), pp. 31 – 43, Springer, Singapore.

http://link.springer.com/chapter/10.1007/978-3-319-29643-2_3



Specialities: Operations Research, Stochastic Simulations, Statistical Analysis, Partial Differential Equations, Excel, VBA, Matlab, C/C++.



Professional Interest: Robust and Resilient Design, Machine Learning, Data Science & Engineering

headline: Avanade|Singapore Management University| Azure Data Scientist Associate
about:
It is an exciting and challenging time to be a data scientist.



With Avanade, I work on delivering data science solutions with clients who have use cases related to recommendation engines, NLP, face verification on the edge, etc.

Being an individual who has a keen sense for numbers and algorithms, I completed a masters from the Singapore Management University, which is also ranked as Asia's top ranked degree in Analytics.

My under-graduation at National University of Singapore not only strengthened me as a quantitative person but made me an enthusiastic orator. It set the foundation for me to thrive in challenges and work in collective learning environments.

I enjoy participating in various data related competitions/innovation challenges.

My key interest lie in recommender systems, NLP, AI on the edge and evaluating what are good use cases for analytics.

Read more about my tryst with data science at https://medium.com/kishan19

headline: An enthusiastic computational physicist with 10 years experience in quantum Monte Carlo method
about:
I am a computational physicist specialized in Monte Carlo method and machine learning. I believe that both machine learning and Monte Carlo method can generate much value in this big-data driven era. My career goal is to develop an efficient algorithm in machine learning and Monte Carlo method, that can contribute to the development of data science.



• Experience in deep learning (CNN,FCN and computer vision) and machine learning (data cleaning, data boosting, feature selection, ensemble)



• Experience in code optimization and parallelization, usage of supercomputing cluster / multi-GPUs.



• Proficient in Python (pandas,scipy,sklearn,numpy), Keras and TensorFlow; also MATLAB, Mathematica, Fortran; good knowledge in C++; familiar with Git, Linux bash environment.



• Seven years of research experience in using Monte Carlo method in theoretical modelling, mentored by two well-known numerical physicists from China and Germany. First author publication in Science and PRL.

headline: Data Scientist at UBS
about:
Aidyia Ltd is a hedge-fund that uses artificial intelligence techniques to forecast price movements in capital markets.

• Designed three proprietary machine learning based trading strategies; these form the core of the current trading system. I was solely responsible for their conceptualization, development and evaluation, while closely working with the CTO.

• Designed a proprietary engine to combine trading signals from multiple strategies using market conditions as a key input.

• Improvised upon a key existing proprietary machine learning trading algorithm.
