headline: Lead data scientist, senior quant
about:
Robert received his PhD in machine learning from the School of Computer Engineering, Nanyang Technological University (NTU), Singapore. During his PhD study, he mainly did research in machine learning and data mining, especially the credit risk management with ensemble learning and outlier detection with kernel methods. During his undergraduate study, he did research in statistics and operations research.



Now he is a data scientist in the Standard Chartered Bank (SCB), and is strongly passionate about how to apply data mining/machine learning techniques into finance with big data. He has joined in various marketing and finance industry projects. He has also learned much about corporate finance, financial engineering, accounting, economics and econometrics. He has explored machine learning models and econometrics in finance research, like using approximate dynamic programming and online learning in portfolio optimization.

headline: Senior Data Scientist
about:
Working as a data scientist and BI expert during the past 10 years, I have worked in several European and Asian countries on challenging and super interesting projects: like detecting tax frauds, optimizing campaign spending and identifying opinion leaders among telco / PFS banking Customers - with the help of graph theory & AI.



Although my main focus is data analysis, I have experience on leading small groups of data scientists and organizing internal training.



Believing, the present and future of data science is based on network analysis and AI, I work with Lynx, who do both. I am trying to grow up to these new challenges via learning continuously. Currently I am focusing on developing my leader skills, due to I would like to build a small, enthusiastic and very well skilled data science team in the near future.





Feel free to ask me about the following topics

-----------------------------------------------------

 Identifying Influencers and opinion leaders, creating influence graph (both Telco and banking)

 Using python & Spark for data mining

 Using geo-pandas and OSM for supporting Customer micro-segmentation

 Creating Single Customers View and Single Household View over SIM cards (both in prepaid / postpaid marked, both in developed and 3rd world countries)

 Classifying Social Connections among Customers (how to distinguish friendship from colleagues, family members etc.)

 Supporting and Optimizing Campaigns: e.g. how to build product affinity and channel sensitivity models, or how to handle revenue cannibalization.

 How to improve current Churn or Attrition models with Graph Theory

 What are Carousel Frauds (tax / VAT), and how to fight against it smartly, using analytics & graph theory

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Sea
about:
• Consulting with internal customers (e.g. Operation, Marketing, etc.) to develop analyses/models that lead to actionable insights that ensure profitability and stability of the product.

• Work with Product Manager on cross-region product strategy and operation planning by doing in-depth big data analytics.

• Take charge of the redesign and renovation of the cross-platform user behavior event tracking framework for improved data quality, easier maintenance and efficient analysis, whereby the project involves different platforms' developers, data engineers, system admins and product managers.

• Design, develop and optimise interactive Business Intelligence tools for different data/visualization needs which eliminate manual work and save manpower dramatically.

• Cooperate with Data Engineer on Data Warehouse construction and continous optimization.

• Largely improved data distribution efficiency and reliability by creating customized/integrated views for both regional and local teams using Hadoop and Spark.

headline: Quasi-rigorous Data Scientist at GovTech Singapore
about:
A very relieved recent PhD graduate putting my skills for the public's good at Govtech. I am having a great deal of fun in fraud detection and market segmentation projects.



In my previous life in research I developed and applied network-based techniques to reveal insights from data sets as diverse as pedagogy, language, and biology.



My specialties include:

(i) Mathematical Modelling - Complex networks, Emergent Phenomena, Computational physics, etc.

(ii) Machine Learning - Linear/logistic regression, SVM, ANN, Clustering and community detection

headline: Data Scientist at Singapore Pools
about:
-Lead the Customer Relationship Management test team for 1 Year handling all the client requirements and coordinating with the onsite team and the development team on the daily basis.

- Worked for 1 year as Functional Tester for Customer Relationship Management Database handling customer details, transaction, loyalty programs and UNIX server programs using Unix Shell Scripting, SQL Developer and SQL Server.

- Worked as a Functional Tester for Digital Messaging System (Marketing SMS, Emails and Display Ads), testing various web services and UNIX programs.

- Worked as an Automation Tester for 1 Year, automating 85% of Digital Messaging System Test Suite using Java Scripting in Rational Functional Tester, Visual Basics in Outlook Macro and Groovy Scripting in SOAP UI.

- The Automation includes UI Testing, Database Testing, Web services and Email Content testing in a single flow.

- Worked on Automatic Server switchover project and tested 81 test cases (18 hours work) in 8 hours due to critical project timelines.

- Created tools in Excel and automation tools using UNIX shell scripting which were of daily use and which saved a lot of manual effort.

- Created Test Plan, Test Scenarios, Test Cases, Test approach, Test closure and Traceability Matrix for each project.

- Won Employee of the month award for my performance and zero defect project deliveries.

headline: Chief Data Scientist
about:
David Low is currently the Co-founder and Chief Data Scientist at Pand.ai, building AI-powered chatbot to disrupt and shape the booming conversational commerce space with Deep Natural Language Processing. He represented Singapore and National University of Singapore (NUS) in Data Science Game'16 at France and clinched top spot among Asia and America teams. Recently David has been invited as a guest lecturer by NUS to conduct masterclasses on applied Machine Learning and Deep Learning topics. Prior to Pand.ai, he was a Data Scientist with Infocomm Development Authority (IDA) of Singapore.



Throughout his career, David has engaged in data science projects ranging from Manufacturing, Telco, E-commerce to Insurance industry. Some of his works including sales forecast modeling and influencer detection had won him awards in several competitions and was featured on IDA website and NUS publication. Earlier in his career, David was involved in research collaborations with Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) and Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) on separate projects funded by National Research Foundation and SMART. As a pastime activity, he competed on Kaggle and achieved Top 0.2% worldwide ranking.



Recent wins in competitions:

• 1st place in Glencore’s Zinc Recovery Optimisation Challenge

• 1st place in Alibaba-Tianchi Gridlock Prediction Challenge (re KDD Cup 2017 Task 1)

• 2nd place in OZ Minerals Explorer Challenge - Data Science Stream

headline: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence / Computational Intelligence / Machine Learning)
about:
Whye Loon has been in the field of data science since obtaining his PhD in 2004. He was a recipient of the Singapore Millennium Foundation (SMF) Postdoctoral Research Scholarship in 2004 and the Lee Kuan Yew Postdoctoral Fellowship in 2006, which supported his post-doctoral research at Nanyang Technological University (NTU). His research interests include computational intelligence, machine learning algorithms, and data mining and analytics. Since 2006, he has developed an intense research interest in the field of computational finance, and to equip himself with the relevant financial knowledge, he has completed a Master of Science degree in Financial Engineering at the Risk Management Institute (RMI), National University of Singapore (NUS). He has worked on the modeling and forecasting of dynamic financial time-series data. The techniques developed have been applied to the construction of autonomous trading systems for the buying and selling of equities using technical trading rules, pricing of options on currency futures, financial volatility modeling and forecasting and the trading of straddle options, as well as the dynamic construction of efficient portfolios. In addition, reinforcement learning has been used for the optimization of trading rule parameters. Whye Loon is currently a Data Scientist with the Analytics Centre of Excellence (DataFirst program) at DBS, and he is also an Associate Faculty at the Singapore University of Social Sciences (former UniSIM), delivering three full courses in data analytics. Summary of research publications: https://www.researchgate.net/profile/Whye_Loon_Tung



HONORS AND AWARDS

2006 – 2009: Lee Kuan Yew (LKY) Postdoctoral Fellowship

2004 – 2006: Singapore Millennium Foundation (SMF) Postdoctoral Fellowship

2000 – 2004: NTU Research Studentship Award

1994: Temasek Junior College Academic Excellence Award for 1993 GCE-A Levels

1992: Chung Cheng High School (Main) Academic Excellence Award for 1991 GCE-O Levels

headline: We are hiring data scientist, Data Science at NTUC Enterprise
about:
Wei Chen is now Data Science Manager (Vice President) at the The Centre of Excellence for Data, Digitalisation and Technology NTUC. Before joining NTUC, he took the role of data scientist in different industry Development Bank of Singapore Limited (DBS), Singapore Telecommunications Limited (SingTel) ,Research Scientist at Institute for Infocomm Research, A*STAR and Research Assistant in the School of Computing at the National University of Singapore. headline: Lead Data Scientist, Graph Analytics at Shopee
about:
• Involve in the design and development of stellargraph.io, a graph-based Investigative Analytics Platform.

• In-charge of designing and developing Entity Resolution framework at scale, for ~1 billion nodes record linkage and deduplication.

• In-charge of designing and developing community detection and new pattern discovery approaches for fraud and criminal detections, focusing on money laundering, terrorism financing, organised crime and tax evasion.

• In-depth knowledge in entity resolution technique (using deep learning, meta-blocking approach), graph-analytics (using networkx, graph-tool, GraphFrame), distributed computing framework (Apache Spark, Flink), machine learning libraries (MLlib, scikit-learn), deep-learning framework (tensorflow, GCN, node2vec).

• In-depth knowledge in continuous integration continuous delivery tools: github, Maven, docker, travis CI

• Collaborating with external customers such as Australian Taxation Office (ATO), Australian Transaction Reports and Analysis Center (AUSTRAC), Australian Federal Police (AFP) to understand problems and their data, and communicate results and insights to audiences with differing technical backgrounds.

• Collaborating with research, engineering and business teams across Data61 to ensure that project goals and Data61’s goals are achieved.

• Providing technical direction, taking ownership of projects, presenting ideas and fostering creativity in others.

• 3 years hands-on experience in mathematical modeling and optimization techniques. In-depth knowledge in linear programming (LP), mixed-integer programming (MIP), large neighbourhood search (LNS) using Python and optimization tools such as Gurobi, CPLEX, SCIP, and IPOPT.
• Good knowledge of machine learning techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, support vector machine, k-means clustering, neural network and recommendation system, and data analytic tools such as R, SciPy.

Research Highlights/Outputs:
• Designed and developed:
algorithms and mathematical models to solve joint HVAC control and occupancy scheduling problems.
mathematical programming models to address the challenges of combining discrete scheduling problem and non-convex non-linear HVAC control problem.
machine learning techniques to improve HVAC and building models using large-scale building datasets.
a large neighbourhood search (LNS) algorithm to handle large-scale models.
an online scheduling model to cope with impromptu job requests and cancellations.
a robust optimization model to dynamically control occupied thermal comfort bounds based on outdoor temperature and user preference
• Performed model validation using building energy simulation software Energy+ and Simergy.
• Others:
Developed a mixed-integer non-linear (MINLP) model for HVAC control.
Explored hybrid discrete-continuous model using constraint programming (CP) model.
• Filed an international PCT patent entitled “Controlling operation of energy-consuming devices” on the core techniques and the system of the research work above on Jul’15.
• Published and presented 3 conference papers in top-class conferences in the area including AAAI. See less'}, {'title': 'Staff Engineer', 'company': 'MIMOS Berhad', 'duation_date': '2011 – 2013', 'duration_length': '2 yrs', 'description': '• Conduct R&D in Cloud Computing project, which was funded under the Malaysia’s 10th Plan (2010-2015).
• Performed R&D on resource provisioning techniques on MIMOS Cloud Computing platform.
• Designed a network utilization prediction algorithm to estimate the various network resources utilization (such as latency, bandwidth, memory and processing power) for delay-sensitive cloud applications.

• Led a team and developed, in close collaboration with Panasonic worldwide R&D labs, various R&D projects in multiparty video conferencing, AV streaming, AV transcoding, home media network.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Grab
about: With a first degree in Physics and a PhD in Bioengineering, Laiyi had been involved in several multidisciplinary research projects in A*STAR and NUS since 2008. His main research interest was on the development of biomedical diagnostics devices and microfluidic platforms. Having obtained a Masters in Business Analytics in 2018, Laiyi is trained on a comprehensive data analytics skillset that includes traditional machine learning, deep learning, operations research, causality analysis, database query and data visualization. A 3-month internship with DBS bank provided his first industrial data science experience working with a real-world natural language processing problem. Eager to further his data science education, Laiyi went on to complete a 9-month deep-skilling program as an AI Apprentice at AI Singapore. Currently a data scientist at Grab, Laiyi hopes to deliver business value and a positive impact with his skills and experience.

headline: Data scientist, healthcare
about:
Holmusk is a global digital health and data analytics company, focused on solving complex problems in healthcare for chronic diseases.



We build innovative, scalable and cost-effective digital behaviour change programs that combine cutting-edge clinical research, technology and design to nudge people towards sustainable changes for better health. We develop powerful predictive algorithms that offer actionable insights for personalised care and population health management. We are based in Singapore and USA.



Our flagship behaviour change program is Glyco Leap, a smart coach for Type 2 diabetes. Beautifully designed, simple to use and convenient.



Learn more @ glycoleap.com

headline: Data Scientist
about: I am a Data Scientist and ML Engineer particularly interested in solving complex problems with simple and elegant solutions. I have deployed this skills in the context of biomedical imaging, helping biologists by building a pipeline capable of extracting relevant genetic information from large number of images at once. I also worked in the banking sector, using Natural Language Processing in the context of KYC and anomaly detection. Lastly, I used NLP to build a tool for automatic webpage categorization, and built from the ground up a crawler simulation and predictor.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Carousell
about:
Shannon kickstarted the Data Team in Carousell building up ETL & BI reporting processes. Subsequently, he helped build its Machine learning infrastructure and is responsible for various data-driven features within Carousell, including models for search, spam and recommendation. Currently, he is responsible for building Deep learning models for Ads Targeting in Carousell.



As a person who enjoys tinkering, Shannon likes to create useful tools for his friends and family as side projects. He is also a drone enthusiast, having built his own drone and hoping to orchestrate a swarm of drones one day.

"Stay Hungry, Stay Foolish" - Steve Job



I am a person who love to challenge myself and push myself to limits. I have developed strong interest towards machine learning during my first internship at Dentsu Aegis Network. headline: Senior Data Scientist at McLaren Applied Technologies
about:
I am a versatile professional in the application of Engineering Principles and Process Systems Engineering (PSE) techniques to address global needs and challenges.

I have

1) 12 years of research and industrial experience in the real time application of Big Data analytics, Mathematical modeling, Control & Optimization in the field of Energy (Oil & Gas, Petrochemical Power, Cement), Healthcare and Transportation sectors

2) 10 years of experience in Intellectual property management and patent/Journal/Conference publications

3) 7 years of experience in managing and executing Proof of Concept Projects, Presales activities, Software development/Project management, Stakeholder management, providing customer support and negotiating with clients

4) Experience in Physiological, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmcodynamics modelling and optimization of therapeutic protocol design, Population health analytics

3) Handled large industrial data sets using Data mining/analytics, Mathematical modelling for Asset Management/ Control loop performance monitoring projects:

4) Experience in the operation of Yokogawa Distributed Control Systems (DCS), PID loop tuning in various systems (Centum VP, Siemens PLC and GE PLC)



FIELDS OF INTEREST: Artificial intelligence, Digitization and Automation, Decision making, Business analytics, Conversion of research concepts to commercial software products, Industrial Internet/Internet of Things (IoT), Project management, IP management



SPECIALITIES: Data mining and analysis, Design of experiments, Signal processing (Time series & Frequency domain analysis), Machine/Deep learning, Root cause and risk analysis, Mathematical modeling and simulation, Numerical modeling methods (both Ordinary Differential & Partial Differential Equations), System identification, Optimization (Single & multiobjective).



PROGRAMMING LANGUAGES: MATLAB/SIMULINK, COMSOL, FORTRAN, C, SQL

DATA MINING TOOLS: R, ACE, MARS, TREENET, CART, Genetic Programming, Neural networks

headline: Applied Data Science & AI @ Grab | Data Driven Problem Solving
about:
- Mathematical Modeling, Data Analysis, Rigorous A/B testing, Strategic Business Decision making, Software Development

- Ideate and prototyped Demand estimation (based on intent) model and fore-casted demand model using supervised machine learning and time series method (To be Patented)

- Ideate, prototyped and productized several "customer behavioral models" such as promo sensitivity model, life time value model, churn prediction model, price sensitivity model, vertical affinity model, promo elasticity model which are used company wide by several analytics team for growth and targeting leading to substantial cost reductions (~100 Million USD), hyper-growth and strategic decision making

- Ideate Deep Reinforcement Learning based framework (MDP/POMDP model) for building personalised CRM, dynamic pricing, etc. using CNN, LSTM, unsupervised embeddings (using concepts from NLP), etc.

- Ideate personalized real-time dynamic discount system for increasing the overall network efficiency

- Using Python, Spark- SparkSQL and ML library, Presto, Airflow, Zeppelin, Jupyter, Tableau, XGBoost, sklearn, Amazon Web Services, Keras, Tensorflow, etc.



Previous Roles: Data Scientist

headline: Trust me, I'm a (data) scientist
about:
A physicist by training but an engineer at heart. who after finishing his PhD transitioned into data science due to the multi-disciplinary nature of the field. Currently, I wear two hats at Geospock Singapore's office: data scientist and sales engineer.



As a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer, I have delivered several predictive analytics and data visualisation projects, in fields such as financial modelling, failure prediction, natural language processing, image detection, process optimisation, ETL pipelines for digital twins and visualisation of energy consumption.



During my career, I have developed a strong familiarity with Python, Spark, Django, SQL, Machine Learning and Deep Learning/Neural Networks.

headline: Data Scientist | Multi-Disciplinary | jironghuang.github.io
about:
I'm a versatile data scientist that understands the supply chain of Analytics: 1.) Sourcing for raw data (Web-Crawling, Social Media APIs) 2.) Database (SQL) 3.) Analysis (Statistics, Econometrics, Machine-Learning) and 4.) Delivery (Interactive Data visualizations through Qliksense/ R shiny, Automated Reports, Intranet). In addition, I possess strong project-management and communication skills essential in delivering results to stakeholders.



I am currently pursuing a Computer Science Masters (Remote Learning) in Georgia Institute of Technology. And I enjoy the rigour of the curriculum that exposes me to different facets of computer science.



Given that issues are increasingly complex, I embrace a multidisciplinary approach in analysing and understanding issues; I'm passionate about data analytics, economics, finance, organisational behaviour and programming.



Fun Facts:

- I work in a tech division but has a slight academic inclination when I develop or explain my models / results.

- I aspire to be a Dev-Ops and Full stack data scientist.



You may reach me at jironghuang88@gmail.com/linkedin if you would like to discuss,

-Job opportunities in the field of data science or quantitative finance

-Data analytics/visualization, programming (e.g R/ Python package development)

-Algorithmic trading /quantitative investment strategies

-Journal papers, conference proceedings



If you wish to see some of my past work (unfortunately, I'm only able to upload my personal projects), you may visit my github account @ https://github.com/jironghuang . I hope to add in more interesting codes/work over time.



I've also just started a blog here @ https://jironghuang.github.io/ where I try to explore investment strategies and interesting topics through analytics. Feel free to drop me a comment in the blog or my mail, jironghuang88@gmail.com.



Over the course of my career, I hope to think, learn, experiment, code and write more!

about:

headline: Head of Data Science (Machine Learning and Maps) at Grab
about:
As the head of Data Science for Machine learning and the Maps team, I am excited about bringing research outcomes from the arena of machine learning, and artificial intelligence into live products that reaches customers' hands and delights them. I have successfully built and managed large data science teams, researchers, Post-docs, PhD students and software engineers in building AI centric products.



Research: My research interests are broadly in the areas of Computer Vision and Machine Learning. I have several years of experience working on Bayesian Inference, Topic/Graphical models, Deep learning models. I have co-authored nearly 25 papers that were accepted in top peer-reviewed conferences and journals including IJCV, TPAMI, and conferences such as CVPR, ICCV, and BMVC etc.



Education: I completed my Ph.D at Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne and Idiap Research Institute, Switzerland in August 2012. For my doctoral thesis, I worked on the problem of unsupervised activity analysis from long term sensors logs, with a special focus on data coming from video streams. The models developed in my Ph.D were tested and demonstrated using videos from several metro stations across Europe. This was done in the context of a European union project called VANAHEIM (www.vanaheim-project.eu).



Prior to my PhD, I worked at HP Labs and GE Global research, Bangalore, India, from 2005 to 2008, where I contributed to several projects in document image analysis, online handwriting recognition, medical image analysis and information retrieval.



Speaker: Spoken in various conferences and international forums



Specialties

Video Analysis, Visual Surveillance, Graphical Models, Bayesian Inference, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Data Mining and Software Engineering





For more details please visit my webpages:

http://adsc.illinois.edu/people/jagannadan-varadarajan

https://sites.google.com/site/vjagan/

headline: Data Scientist at Merck & Co. (MSD)
about:
• Data scientist with a focus on growth and business planning.

• Outperformer of Merck/MSD's Global Data Science Competency in 2018.



- Opportunity Sizing and Market Potential Estimations

- Affordability Analysis in AP Markets

- Factor effect analysis with Cox Proportional-Hazards Model

- Predictive models to find accounts that would respond well to discounts

- Marketing Experimental Design and Statistical Analysis (Difference-in-Difference & Fixed effects)

- Causal Effects Analysis (Bayesian Structural Time Series)

- Health Belief Model to Explain and Predict the Behavior Change

- Market Mix Modeling (Fixed effects model, mixed effects model, koyck model, MLE)

- Transition Probability Analysis (Markov Chain, MLE)

- PSR Non-compliant Behavior Detention (Anomaly detection)

headline: Data Scientist at Amaris.AI Pte Ltd
about:
• Self-motivated and conscientious individual with 8 years experience in market risk operations and management in the asset management industry.

• Seasoned financial engineer with strong software development, financial product modelling and data management background.

• Experienced in performing data and financial analysis on ultra-large datasets.

• Result-driven and self-initiated project manager with proven knowledge and experience in system implementation, process improvement, software development and risk operations.

• A structured and organised team player who is entrepreneurial minded and willingness to take up new challenges.

• Completed Data Science Specialisation Course by Johns Hopkins University on Coursera in 6 months. Well equipped with the necessary skills to perform data and predictive analysis with structured and unstructured data.

headline: Chief Data Officer ASPAC at KPMG Lighthouse | Singapore | Data, Analytics & Blockchain
about:
Track record of delivering data & analytics solutions for global brands and government.



Expertise in architecting and building blockchain and machine learning systems at massive scale for retail, media, digital services, including public sector.



Focusing on digital ledger technology, deep learning, natural language processing, recommendations and psychology to deliver personalised digital experiences.



Developed several smart-contract projects on the Ethereum and Stellar blockchains including ICO’s.



Entrepreneurial experience both running and working in startups undergoing exponential growth.

headline: Data Scientist at iKompass
about:
Prakash Roshan is heading data science projects with iKompass. Currently working as a Machine Learning consultant for an Investment bank on computer vision for authentication.



Roshan is a technology entrepreneur passionate about coding. Roshan has authored various books and articles on data science, programming and project management. His core interests lie in bringing statistics, technology and human behavior together. Roshan has led and managed projects for many MNCs in a consulting role. His most recent stint has been with a major investment bank to use machine learning to identify malicious behavior.



Roshan likes solving complex problems through creative solutions. Most of his career has been around finding creative solutions by merging data, technology and human motivations. This stems from his college background in Statistics, computer science and psychology. Roshan has a masters degree from the University of Birmingham.



His major strengths include building data lakes, working with artificial neural networks, applying non linear algorithms, finding patterns with unsupervised learning and creating a data driven culture across the organization.



When he is not coding or refining algorithms, he is busy doing muy thai, Scuba diving, rock climbing, tennis or hiking. Roshan is a very big fan of the authors Daniel Kahnman and Amor Tversky. He spends time in Singapore, New York and London each year.

headline: Senior Data Scientist at Sopra Steria
about: A highly skilled, talented and knowledgeable Data Scientist candidate with more than 5-years experiences in industry and 3-years in academic research. In addition, I have been trained with strong background in Mathematics, Statistics and Machine Learning. My experiences have been built up from multiple projects in different types of data and different business domains. I am experienced in Data Analytics projects at different levels: academic research, industrial-academic research, proof of concept, business solution, API production solution. Moreover, I also have some skills and experiences for Project Management, Client Delivery and Engagement, Technical Consultants.

headline: Data Scientist at GIC supporting Public Equities. PhD holder in Applied Mathematics.
about:
I am currently working as a data scientist with the Public Equities team in GIC. In this role, I use NLP techniques to analyse unstructured text data to derive useful insight for portfolio managers.



From November 2017 till March 2019, I was with the Internal Audit department in GIC. My main task was to implement advanced analytics algorithms for the purpose of continuous auditing.



I am familiar with standard big data frameworks like Apache Spark, Apache Hadoop etc. I have more than 4 years of industry experience in using Python for building machine learning models, data exploration and analysis using libraries like Pandas, scikit-learn, PySpark, NLTK, SpaCy etc. I have deployed multiple prototypes in production in the span of my career as a data scientist.



My PhD thesis was on streaming algorithms, where I analysed algorithms to process massive datasets, given limited memory and time resources. My work has been published in various computer science conferences. My research thesis was in the area of theoretical computer science, where we used advanced mathematical tools to solve problems related to processing massive datasets efficiently.

headline: Data Scientist at Agilent Technologies
about:
I am a 'Data Science' enthusiastic individual with vested interests in 'Predictive Modeling'. As part of my academic learning, I have acquired skills in discovering the insights hidden in large scale data, performing statistical analysis, Data Modeling and translating evaluations into customer-centric solutions.



In my recent past, I have undertaken various projects using Python, R, Statistics and Machine Learning. I possess the ability to coordinate with end users for designing and implementation of analytics solutions as per project proposals. I can easily prepare scripts to automate Data pipelines, ensure accurate Data Manipulation and build functions for Model Building & Predictions with Python programming language.



As such I believe, I am an autodidact with strong communication skills, and eye for detail. I am willing to undertake challenging roles that require out of box thinking, complex problem solving, analytical skills and provide a conducive environment for both professional and personal growth.



If you wish to know more about me, you can connect with me on LinkedIn. 😊

headline: Data Science Manager at Indeed.com
about:
More than 10 years of research and development experience on machine learning, data mining and statistical modelling for real world data analytics. Worked for many different industries like consumer, telco, healthcare and finance, with strong hands-on experiences on large-scale data manipulation, wrangling, processing on distributed systems like Hadoop with its ecosystems and scalable machine learning on Apache Spark and GraphLab.

Applied data analytics to solve business problem such as geo-location based service, consumer marketing, product recommendation and deployed to both batch and real-time systems.

Life-long learner and passionate on machine learning and data mining. Long time user of MOOC learning. Passionate about the recent innovation and trends of analytics and statistical science.

headline: Associate Computational Scientist at GovTech Singapore
about:
Data scientist forward-deployed to Ministry of Manpower (MOM). My core responsibilities include lending technical expertise to larger-scale business analytics projects, and educating public officers and middle-managers to upskill their competencies in data analytics.



* Collaborated with business users and IT team to deploy machine learning model into production

* Developed risk models to prioritize high risk workplaces for safety inspections

* Provided mentoring to public officers transitioning into data analytics related job roles

* Conducted technical, hands-on workshops for middle-managers

headline: VP, Data Science at Gojek | Ex-Uber, Redmart/Lazada
about:
Results oriented Data Science Lead.



Over 10 years of research experience in the field of mathematical modelling and numerical simulations.



Experience in Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence and its applications in research, automation and business transformation.



I participate in Kaggle competitions for fun. https://www.kaggle.com/maneeshkm



Algorithms: Regression, Gradient Boosted Trees, Support Vector Machines, Neural Networks, Deep Learning, Natural Language Processing



Analytical skills: Statistics, Analytics, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Scientific Research and Analysis, Big Data, Predictive Modeling, Data Mining, Mathematical Modeling, Numerical Simulation, PDEs



Software skills: Python (Pandas, Numpy, Scipy, Scikit-Learn, PySpark and more), R (caret, randomForest, nnet, e1071, kernlab), Tableau, Matlab, Scala, Maple, MapReduce, Spark, MLlib, Hadoop, C/C++, Visualization Libraries

headline: Data Scientist at Surbana Technologies
about:
Develop predictive maintenance solutions with:

- Descriptive and Diagnostic Analytics: Perform diagnosis on historical records from equipment sensor data, data preparation, exploratory data analysis and data visualization with business intelligence tools; to derive correlations between data behavior and equipment failures.

- Predictive and Prescriptive Analytics: Perform feature engineering and data modeling with machine learning techniques to predict future failures; and derive insights on possible causes of failures, perform cost-benefit analysis.

- Big Data Engineering: Engineer big data from real-time sensor data streaming on Spark platform with map-reduce, resilient distributed dataset and machine learning.



Perform operational database maintenance:

- assist to maintain, enhance and optimize databases for operational needs.

headline: Director of Data Science at PropertyGuru Group
about:
Hello, my name is Setu Chokshi



WHO I AM: I’m a senior technical leader, innovator and specialist in machine learning and artificial intelligence. I'm also a leader who has gained the respect of my team through active listening and delegating tasks aligned to talents.



MY BACKGROUND has occurred organically as technical triumphs have led to greater opportunities. I’ve been fortunate to have worked with industry behemoths—General Electric and Nielsen.



PROUD MOMENTS:

✔ Microsoft MVP for AI

✔ Participated in a 1300-question survey for 25,000 people—one of the largest ever completed.

✔ Patents: an image quality recognition methodology that out-performed state-of-the-art methodologies; a process for reducing biofouling using electric fields.

✔ Developed a machine learning management platform that created and managed 4000+ models per country delivered at sub-millisecond speeds. Used to scale across 68 countries.

✔ Created an optimizer for machine learning that outpaced commercial state-of-the-art optimizers.

✔ Conceived a working pilot using deep learning that reduced data coding quality issues.

✔ Winner, Inter-Collegiate Open Software Design Contest, Bombay, 2004. Software licensing (copy protection and application licensing) using cryptography, IIT Madras, 2002. IIT Bombay 2002 (One-the-Fly Encryption system).

✔ Presented Commercial Software Security and Ethical Hacking—cryptography, penetration testing and buffer overflow exploits (SecNet 2003 and 2005).



MY SPEAKING ENGAGEMENTS

✔ Presented 8-hour session—Getting Started with Azure Machine Learning—in partnership with Microsoft User Group. Four, two-hour classes cover 60-70% of the algorithm on Azure machine learning

✔ Machine Learning 101, IOT Asia 2017, Singapore

✔ Time Series Predictions using Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM), IOT Asia 2017, Singapore

✔ State of Art Recommender System with Azure Machine Learning, Azure Boot Camp, Singapore

✔ An Introduction to Classification Algorithms, Credit Agricole

✔ Partnered with business leaders to identify controls and risks in their processes, and assisted them with the development and execution of testing to successfully complete control self-assessments in compliance with Sarbanes Oxley (SOX) requirements.

✔ Directed a team of GE Researchers to explore new analytical solutions for statistical models in the long term revenue accounting for GE’s Infrastructure businesses (Aviation, Transportation, and Energy).

headline: Chief Data scientist at DataRobot
about:
French actuary with near 20 years of working experience in France, Brazil, China and Singapore.

Converted into data science in 2011, I gained experience in Machine Learning by competing on Kaggle. Won 10 prizes and was the #1 ranked data scientist on Kaggle in 2012­-2013.

Work for DataRobot, a venture-backed predictive analytics software company.

Before becoming a data science enthusiast, I held various roles in the life and general insurance industry: Actuary, Deputy Head of Budget and Planning dpt, Chief Actuary, Finance Director, Risk Manager...

headline: Data Science at NTT
about:
With experience in commercial analytics, my mission is to drive every strategic commercial decision with precise decision intelligence engineering methods with effective partnering and process planning



Currently as a part of Global Client Success at NTT, the aim is to proactively align a dedicated manager to clients in different continents that research and data would suggest a mutually beneficial relationship. The main technology behind the program is to run success plays (automated set of tasks) which will trigger actions based on data to effectively expand through up-sells and cross-sells, increase platform adoption and ensure timely contract renewals.



My intelligence journey with Zalora has been in evolving analytics from the ground up by implementing self-service analytics platform by managing internal, external and team dependent stakeholders. developing data infrastructure whenever needed and enabling key decision makers in the company by providing them with cutting-edge analytic insights



I began my career with Marina Bay Sands which is one of the iconic destinations of Singapore under Casino Marketing analytics. Campaign management and CRM was at the core of what I did here, exposing me to customer segmentation, CLV and spend attributions. as a part of Sands reward, we provided strategic insights to enable and develop key partnerships with continent`s most luxurious brands



Among other things, I love soccer (fusbol included), I make it a point to visit at least 2 new countries each year. I am a connoisseur of food and at the same time, I believe what flying is to birds, running is to man and I try to run whenever possible. I practice yoga as well. More recently I have started writing various articles to share my views and thoughts in the field of analytics.

headline: Lead Data Scientist at StarHub
about:
Provided in-depth data analysis and address collaborators’ inquiries.



Built statistical models and algorithms using data mining techniques for processing downstream analysis on large volume of data.



Designed and implemented a legacy MicroBiome Abundance Analysis Suite - MBAA Suite, for the analysis of the 16S rRNA gene microbiome profiles associations using generalized linear mixed model based techniques, Principle Components Methods, time series, and alpha/beta diversities. Built from scratch using open sourced R.



Led on several pipeline development projects designed for Illumina shotgun sequencing of 16S rRNA amplicon sequences and RNA viruses.



Collaborated with Danone to investigate the microbial profile on a cohort of infants fed with different milk formula.

about:

1. Digital servicing models project: identify customer service journeys, migrate customers to digital channels (website, mobile app, chatbot), build prediction models for customer service needs

2. AWS/cloud initiatives

3. NLP reusable assets

4. Secure data access and environment

5. Data science platforms

6. GPU computing



Supervised 3 intern students for graph analytics, service request prediction, airflow projects.

headline: Data Science & Artificial Intelligence/Consultant, Trainer, Mentor, Advocate, Researcher/数据分析与人工智能
about:
Data scientist armed with an MBA degree & 14+ years of relevant experience and in an unique intersection of training/education, business and mathematics. Understand the whole process of getting value from data, from data collection to implementation of insights.



Strong & passionate advocate of Data Science & Artificial Intelligence, hoping both business and talents, get on the DS/AI bandwagon to derive tremendous business value. Research interest in how organization can build Data Science & Artificial Intelligence capabilities to derive value from their data. Another research interest is in building Artificial General Intelligence #AGI.



Experienced in Machine Learning, Credit Scorecard, Business Intelligence, Data Governance & Management and NLP. Familiar with SAS, R, Python, SQL, Tableau etc.



Co-founded DataScience.Sg, an interest group on Data Science in Nov 2013, growing it to more than 5000 members within 36 months. Former Chairman of Working Committee, Singapore SAS User Group.



Conducted at least 1600 man-hours of analytics-related training to various professionals inclusive of banking professionals in T&O and for SAS Institute Singapore. Conducted training and lectures in various universities such as NUS, SMU, SUSS and ESSEC. Facilitator for IDA Data Science MOOC Initiative (1st & 2nd Cohort). (http://bit.ly/1lLfj8s) - spoken to more than 200 people on Data Science. Mentor & Trainer in SAS-IDA Data Scientist Consultant Programme.



Appeared in SG TV programme, "Time Machine" (https://bit.ly/2jYEmMQ). Speaker at meetups such as DataScience SG, SAS Bites & SAS Forum (http://bit.ly/1vEvP4O) and MicroElectronics Tech Asia (https://bit.ly/2QubPxj). Presented papers at SAS Global Forum. Data Ambassador for DataKind Singapore. (http://bit.ly/1Q0vXiP). Facilitator at Data Literacy Bootcamp for Journalist organized by World Bank & IDA (https://bit.ly/2OlGEni).



Interest in Economics, Finance, Banking, Business and Ancient China History.

headline: Senior Data Scientist - Data Science and AI Elite at IBM
about:
My interests are in large scale distributed high performance machine learning. The integration of quantitative fields such as computer science, statistics and operations research brings about new and exciting solutions to solve new age problems.



My current focus areas are,

- deep learning

- optimization

- high performance and distributed computing



My experience,

- Conducted qualitative and quantitative analysis for various organizations to derive actionable insights for operations and policy planning.



- Developed analytical models using large amount of data in a high performance distributed computing environment.



- Performed data cleaning, extraction and transformation on big data from different sources. Tuned and indexed database to obtain optimal performance for computation algorithms.
